Reviews.Title: “I would have given them 6 starts if I could”
Reviews.Author: ziad e
Reviews.Content: The week we spent at this hotel was terrific. It was calm, the people were friendly. The second they picked us up from the airport on our experience was great. Mr. Fatih, who works with the hotel, was incredibly nice and polite. My wife and I felt like we knew him for years. The room was cozy and elegant. The view was amazing, looking over the sea. Everything was spectacularly clean and the food was superb. We loved the Turkish style gourmet breakfast! The two people who serve breakfast on the terrace are amazing. You won't forget them. If I ever have the privilege of visiting Istanbul again, I'd never hesitate to stay here again. - Ziad and Najua from Washington DC

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - fantastic location and service with a personal touch”
Reviews.Author: MoutonLondon
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a 4 day trip to Istanbul on the recommendation of friends and it fully lived up to their recommendation and to the reviews on TA. Communication was excellent from before we arrived with prompt and helpful replies to e-mails. Fatih was very helpful throughout our stay as well. This is a small but definitely not cramped hotel. The room and ensuite shower room were both of a good size, but don't expect the acres of space in the chain hotels. This is an entirely different experience and the building is typical of those in the old town (Sultanamet area) The photos on the hotel website give an accurate flavour of the rooms and the standard of fittings is very good - comfortable bed, excellent shower, double-glazed windows. The breakfast served on the roof terrace was a generous buffet with local cheeses, olives and homemade fried pastries as well as the usual muesli, fruit etc. When they found out that I was vegetarian, Hamid asked his wife to make pastries for me with only cheese and leek, leaving out the usual salami. There are views from the roof terrace of the tops of the minarets of the Blue Mosque, in one direction, and over the Sea of Marmara in the other. Everyone was helpful and friendly and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and attentive, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Lisa S
Reviews.Content: My family loved the Osmanhan. The location in Sultanhmet can't be beat. The roof terrace has a lovely view out to the Sea of Marmara. The staff is friendly, helpful and proud of providing a high level if hospitality. I loved some of the homemade items they served at breakfast that were delicious and which the staff took obvious delight in my delight. In terms of value, the Osmanhan is easily a five-star. Potential guests should know that the hotel does not have an elevator (which the staff pointed out to me even before I'd booked the reservation). I only saw our room (41) - it was nicely furnished, impeccably clean, not large, but adequate. It was very quiet for sleeping. I don't know if there were mosques close by, but we never heard the early call to prayer which we heard in other places we stayed in Turkey. If you want super modern or ultra-luxe, the Osmanhan is not for you, but if you are looking for a wonderful local feel with all the pluses I've described, the Osmanhan is great.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in a perfectly placed hotel”
Reviews.Author: msnimer
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved everything in this hotel: from the simple yet great quality of the furniture, the rooms, the service. The breakfast on the roof terrace in particular was absolutely charming. We were very well received by Fatih at the reception, and by the staff serving breakfast. I have absolutely no complaint. I am not surprised the hotel is so positively reviewed. It offers exactly what it promises, is very clean, very well located, has a charming entrance and reception area. I would recommend it in a heartbeat

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Base”
Reviews.Author: MissElizaBennet
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed in a room on the 1/F (2/F to Americans) 7-10th April for 3 nights. The car pick up from the airport was very smooth. We saw a sign with our name as soon as we came through the doors and were taken to our car immediately which was waiting for us a short walk away. On arrival, we were very warmly greeted by Vefa (I think) and given all the relevant information regarding our stay before being taken to our room. We are wine fans and often travel with our own wine and Champagne. The hotel has a great rooftop terrace with views across the city, the Bosphorus and the top of the Blue Mosque, where we could sit and chill with a bottle every evening before going out for dinner. The hotel is perfectly happy for you to bring your own drinks and will provide you with glasses, corkscrew and snacks. One night we saw a couple on the terrace who had got a takeaway from somewhere, and was having a full private dinner by themselves. The hotel is a short walk away from all the main sights and the Grand Bazaar which we spent a lot of time and money at! It is also close to the restaurant street on which we ate every night. It was great to be able to finish a bottle on the rooftop of the hotel, walk to the restaurant within a few minutes and have our meal, then walk back to the hotel after another bottle or two! The breakfast is great quality - everything is fresh and delicious. Every morning there were 2 different kinds of fresh fruit juice, freshly baked items, at least a couple of cooked dishes, a daily changing sweet desert (for example, a cake baked by the owner himself), eggs, a selection of fresh fruits and vegetables, dried fruits, cheeses, olives, breads and cereals. The variety is huge and they make sure that every day they change at least a few things so that you don't get bored. The owner Hamit was at breakfast every morning to give us advice on what to do that day and urge us to eat more. It was like staying at a friend's home, and I loved the cozy friendly atmosphere. Fatih was also great at giving us advice about the city and answering any questions we had - his English is excellent and he is mega friendly (and cute). The cleanliness of all parts of the hotel and our room was outstanding. I am a clean freak to the point of being neurotic, so this coming from me is truly significant. The room is nicely appointed, the bathroom is modern, new and well equipped. There are coffee and tea in the room, a fridge and LCD TV and a powerful aircon. Despite not being on a high floor, we did not have any problems with noise. Basically, there is nothing to fault. On our final day, our car to the airport was 13.30, an hour and a half after the official check out time. We had to vacate our room because the next guest was arriving at noon, but the hotel moved our bags to the room on the G/F and let us use that room until the time we left. We really appreciated that gesture. If I return to Istanbul (very likely) I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality and location make this hotel a true gem”
Reviews.Author: sandytd
Reviews.Content: Our stay was for 3 nights in the last week of March 2012 in the room on the second floor. Based on the reviews from Trip Advisor and the location of Osmanhan, we used the Osmanhan website to book our room. I followed up with the staff via email to discuss the airport transfers and found their communication to be quick and clear. We were met at the airport by a driver assigned by Osmanhan. Upon arrival at Osmanhan, we were greeted warmly by Fatih. He assisted us through the check-in and took us to our room. We stayed at other locations in Turkey over the following two weeks, so I can say with confidence that the room we had at Osmanhan was a great size for two people. We had plenty of room for our luggage and in the bathroom. Throughout our stay, we would ask Fatih for recommendations for local fare or less "touristic traps" and he would always send us to a great find. In fact, after we would go and read the reviews of the restaurants later, they were glowing as well, so Fatih knows his recommendations well. Mehmet was the primary person we saw during our rooftop terrace breakfast and he was very friendly. The hotel is very clean and comfortable. The street noise is comparable to other hotels in the area but the one complaint we had was on one night, being that the front desk was directly below our room, we heard some noise until late into the evening. Overall, the location and hospitality of this hotel makes it quite a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: dytrsi
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently spent a long weekend at the Osmanhan Hotel. We chose it based on its glowing reviews on Tripadvisor and we were not disappointed. The service is excellent. Fateh at the front desk and the rest of the staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome. The location can't be beat. Osmanhan is situated about a 5 minute walk from the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, and the Basilica Cisterns with numerous other attractions (including the Grand Bazar) within walking distance. The view from the terrace is phenomenal. Breakfast on the terrace of Osmanhan was a highlight of our trip, looking out over the rooftops to the golden horn is a perfect way to start the day. I would recommend Osmanhan to anyone traveling to Istanbul whether for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “They really care about you leaving satisfied.”
Reviews.Author: hexalite2k5
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in the room that's at the street level. That is the cheapest room but it does not matter. Our stay was excellent. Here's the best part. The staff is extremely nice and helpful. Their (stated) priority is to make you feel comfortable and satisfied and they do the best they can to accomplish this. Whether you need some toast and tea because you are sick, or you need directions or tips they will help. The breakfast was good and diverse. It is served at the topmost floor where you can also enjoy a view of the Bosphorus. The room was large enough, clean initially and maintained perfectly clean every day. It had a fridge, tv, internet, everything we needed. The location was good, minutes of several important attractions: Aya Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi palace, basilica cistern. How do you get to it from the airport by public transportation? Well, it is not hard at all. I arrived at the Sabiha GÃ¶kÃ§en airport on the Asian side. I took a Havas bus (very comfortable) to Taksim square. Then, the funicular to Kabatas and then the light rail to the Sultanahmet station (the Cankurtaran station is closer but you need to make one more change to get to it). From the Sultanahmet station there is a 5-10 minute walk. You should print the directions in advance, there are many hotels in the area. It is not obvious which way to go. For a good map on public transportation in Istanbul search for "public transport in Istanbul" on Wikipedia. If you have very large/heavy luggage then you may consider a more direct means of transportation. The 5-10 minute walk from Sultanahmet to the hotel is partly on cobblestones and on descending terrain. Not the easiest thing to do with large luggage. There are different options to get from the hotel to the airports too. To get to the large airport (Ataturk airport) we took a shared van. The hotel staff arranged everything for us. It was a very nice place to stay at. I would happily return. Many thanks to Fatih at the reception desk for the help. Communicating in English with him was so easy. Overall, the hotel deserves this great TripAdvisor rating.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience, a great find!”
Reviews.Author: E_Joan_27
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, clean, updated, cozy hotel in a fabulous location! I can't say enough good things about the Osmanhan Hotel. I am a 29 year old American female and was in Istanbul for work this past November. I moved from the Hilton near Taksim once my work meetings were over, and selected Osmanhan based on the shining reviews and easy location to local attractions. Being a single woman traveling alone, I was very concerned about safety, but I must admit that I never once felt unsafe anywhere in Sultanahmet. The hotel was perfectly situated by countless local restaurants, shops, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace and the Grand Bazaar. Fatih and the rest of the hotel team were very friendly, incredibly helpful and went above and beyond to make my stay enjoyable. The rooftop terrace was picturesque and relaxing. The breakfast spread, delicious! I would wholeheartedly recommend Osmanhan to any friend or family member traveling to Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Osmanhan Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cruisindruzin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an absolute gem!! It's location is unbeatable as it is very close to the major sites - the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia are only five minutes away by foot. The Grand Bazaar is a 15 minute walk. It is also about a 5 minute walk to the tram.The hotel is nestled away on a quiet street that is surrounded by other lodgings, restaurants and little stores. There is even a little convenience store a block away if you want snacks or fresh fruit (not a big selection but convenient). My room although small was well laid out. The bathroom was large, and the ac worked well. Breakfast in the morning on the rooftop was more than adequate but what made it truly special, was the view of the Bosphorus. What was truly special was the great service I received. Everyone there was very friendly especially Fatih. He always had a patient answer to every question I asked. He volunteered to loan me a laptop everyday so I could email my family. It really felt like coming home every day! I'd walk through the door, plop on the couch and we would talk for a good 15 minutes about how my day went and what I had learned about this beautiful city. The location, price and TA rating is what made me choose Osman Han originally but the hotel's hospitality is what makes it so superb. I would highly recommend it and would love to return one day. This one is a keeper.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for great location”
Reviews.Author: dipayanb
Reviews.Content: Osmanhan is very well located with the Topkapi Palace, Aya Sofia and Blue Mosque almost equidistant and within 6 minutes of walking. It takes about 10 minutes of walking from the tram station to reach the hotel and there are quite a few food options in the lane next to it. The hotel doesn't have a lift and ground floor room is therefore particularly helpful and whats makes it a winner is that they provide the room at a discount. However, you won't be able to open the windows as the windows are at the street level. The staff is helpful, the breakfast very ordinary, but is served at the terrace, which has a very good view of the Bosphorus. The ground floor room was small, but very clean and well maintained. Overall, a very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location & excellent front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: cruisingcousin
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night in late October, prior to boarding our cruise ship. Wished we had more time. Helpful front desk staff; even brought our suitcases up the stairs to our room. comfy bed; great location; near major attractions. Blue Mosque & Sophia for example. Roof top breakfast was excellent; typical of Turkish cuisine. Magnificent view.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place to Stay if it's Your First Time to Istanbul or if You Just Want Some Personal Attention”
Reviews.Author: Theodora8
Reviews.Content: All I can say is that I am so glad I can trust Trip Advisor to pick my hotels! This is another gem that made a good trip great. The hotel is very close to the major sites - the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia are only five minutes away by foot. The Grand Bazaar is a bit further by foot (I think 10 - 15 minutes). The hotel is nestled away on a quiet street that is surrounded by other lodgings, restaurants and little stores. There's an open market and a little bazaar close by if you want fresh fruits or vegetables. There is even a little convenience store a block away if you want snacks or fresh fruit (not a big selection but convenient). I had a deluxe room, which was perfect. It was standard European size and had a great shower. If I remember correctly I had room 22, which was on the second floor, facing the street. If you're a light sleeper, ask for a higher floor. I'm a heavy sleeper but was woken up twice during my five day stay by smokers from the hostel next door. It's no big deal for me but might be a problem for others. What made me really enjoy my stay was the great service I received. I think the hotel has only ten rooms or less so you get attention you don't normally receive at any place larger. Everyone there was very friendly especially Fatih. He always had a patient answer to every question I asked...and I know I asked a lot of stupid questions. I live in Texas so despite the fact I had read up on Islam, I still knew very little. Fatih always happily answered any new question I had when I'd come back in the evenings. It really felt like coming home every day! I'd walk through the door, plop on the couch and he'd ask what new questions I had for him :) I learned so much about Islam and Turkey just chatting with him. Seriously, that type of friendliness never happens anywhere, not even B&Bs. As a female that travels solo often, this is the best hotel I've ever encountered on my solo adventures. The location, price and TA rating is what made me choose Osman Han originally but the hotel's hospitality is what makes it so superb.

Reviews.Title: “Simply perfect”
Reviews.Author: Joss S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during a 5 day stop over in Istanbul around New Year 2011 / 2012. Everything about the hotel was just perfect: the very friendly staff, the room, and the atmosphere. Everything in the room worked perfectly, from a great shower to a comfortable bed with good bedside lamps to the free Wifi. And complementary coffee/tea. The hotel is also ideally located, just OFF the tourist streets but within 5 minutes walk of Blue Mosque and Aya Sofya. Fatih, the manager, is very relaxed but right on top of things. The other staff we saw mainly at breakfast and we're also providing great service without overdoing it. The only small drawback: the rooms are fairly small, even our De Luxe room. All in all: highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff. Would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: mdibden
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we stayed at the OsmanHan. It is spotlessly clean, the atmosphere is warm & friendly, it's in an ideal location & the staff are amazing & helpful. Fatir comes in for special mention for outstanding service to all guests, but all the staff & the owner provide great service & are warm & welcoming. Breakfasts are a joy with plentiful, healthy foods & a great view over the Sea of Marmara, I kid you not. The young guys serving guests at breakfast also provided great service & were warm & friendly. You cannot go wrong staying here. It is an excellent hotel with excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, centrally located, warm service”
Reviews.Author: premjit_pc
Reviews.Content: While reading up reviews of places to stay, i often wondered how this small 7 roomer got better reviews than the big boys of the hotel industry. We booked for 4 nts and eturned yesterday, thoroughly impressed with the hotel, its service quality and the staff. The hotel is in a quiet side street, which is one turn away from the entry to the Arasta market, which is next to the blue mosque, the heart of the Sultanahment district of Istanbul. One turn from the hotel and you're smack in the middle of the market, the blue mosque, aya sofiya, numerous eating joints, the tram station and more or less everything one could need. We took a ground floor double room since it was the only one available when i booked but found no issues with the rooms, which were superbly done, had comfortable beds, a TV and a mini bar. The bathroom was also good with a superb rain shower cubicle. Hardly any noise from the reception filtered in at any time. Roadside noise was also limited. The breakfast was a small affair but high on quality and we got the usual array of cheeses, breads, eggs and fresh fruits and veggies, enough to keep you going. They served it on the lovely terrace which had wonderful views of the Sea of marmara and the blue mosque. There isnt a bar or all day cafe which is slightly limiting but understandable considering its a small hotel. What you do get is Mehmet (a good natured kid) running up the kitchen and preparing coffee or tea for you whenever you decide to hike (No lifts here) to the terrace during the day. Fatih, the manager was wonderful and helped us book an evening tour with a local which was unlike anything we ever did. Total insight into the life of a person in Istanbul. He also organized other tours like the Bosporous Cruise and helped with innumerable direction guidelines to Taksim Square and the shopping malls. All in all, the young staff namely, Fatih (the manager), Mehmet, Aslan (the 2 youngsters serving breakfast) and Aslan's brother (the night shift manager) were there whenever we needed them. This is a hotel that runs not only on the basis of its approach to quality but also its brilliant team. Thumbs up Folks. The osmanhan is small in size but big on character. Keep it up !!

Reviews.Title: “lived up to reviews”
Reviews.Author: goingon60
Reviews.Content: After spending two weeks touring Turkey, my wife and I opted for this little hotel in Istanbul. If you like a nice quiet place, with a friendly staff, an excellent view of the water while eating a good breakfast, then this is the place. Its main hidden treasure, is that it is in the "old Quarter", just a five minute walk to the "Blue Mosque", "Ste Sophia", the "Topkapi palace", the walkway along the Bosporus, 15 minutes to the main "Bazaars", including the terminal station of the "Orient Express". My wife and I ate locally each night, spent hours walking around the streets, and we never felt "threatened", and the food was extremely good. If you choose this place, We would suggest that you book in for at least one week, as there is so much to see, while you are in Istanbul. As it is an old building, the only problem with the Hotel is the stairs, but, in our opinion, this is far more than made up for, by the friendliness of the staff. Would my wife and I stay here again, definitely YES

Reviews.Title: “The Osmanhan - Great location - Great people - Great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTonto
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at the Osmanhan on November 4, 2011. We were cordially met by the manager, Fatih, who introduced us to the hotel, helped with our bags (no elevator) and helped us find our way to our evening's destination (The Mevlevi Sema Ceremony at the Hodjapasha Culture Centre). Everything about the Osmanhan was a delight. Breakfast on the roof is a great way to get a feel for this unique and diverse city. You are right in the heart of Sultanhamet within walking distance of the major attractions. Our first trip to Istanbul and this hotel made it a success. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay there”
Reviews.Author: urjik
Reviews.Content: Hi all,Being a Istanbul lover it was my third visit this time i opted for Osmanhan hotel(after reading wonderful reviews at TA)instead of usual 4star hotel.Earlier I was bit frightened at my decision but fortunately i didnt regret my decision.We stayed there between 6-9 november2011.Hotel is wonderful little peaceful place in istanbul.Staff is damm good with smiling faces and friendly attitude Breakfast was good. My son being a very fussy eater demanded Fried eggs instead of boiled ones and voila staff didnt mind making fried eggs.I really appreciate all these sincere efforts of staff. We opted for triple room..it wasnt very big but not small either..bathroom was small but what else you can expect in this amount? Room was quite pleasent with lovely view of quiet streets Location of hotel is just excellent where you can have the true flavour of Istanbul,hardly 5 minutes walk from famous blue mosque.Nearby is small market/street with lovely traditional things for buyers. Overall we enjoyed our stay at Osmanhan hotel. Thanks Mr Fatih and all the Staff !!!

Reviews.Title: “The best service and hospitality of Turkish people”
Reviews.Author: baris-lapaix
Reviews.Content: Upon your arrival you are greeted by a very nice smiling young man.I had a chance to stay at this hotel where I have met great people and enjoyed its terrace with the bosphorus view. Our room was very well located looking at the bosphorus and the room itself was absolutely top. It is very close to all historical areas and good transportation services available. Very nice Turkish breakfast that feeds you for the Istanbul's adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Paulina44
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the TA reviews we had read - and we weren't disappointed. The location is perfect - the roof top breakfast terrace had views of the Bosporous, Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. It was easy(and safe) walking to all the main sights and transport. The hotel itself was very comfortable and had a nice "feel". We also stayed recently at a brand new hotel in Istanbul which was nice - but the Osmanhan had more character. Fatih manned the desk for most of our stay and was delightful and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Top of Its Class”
Reviews.Author: bienterry
Reviews.Content: This hotel, with just seven bedrooms and a breakfast room would probably be called a chambre dâ€™hÃ´te if it was in France. Conveniently situated close to the Blue Mosque and with views of the Marmara sea it has the personal touch often found in this type of Establishment Our bedroom, on the 3rd floor, had an Edwardian feeling with its dark colours and sombre lighting. It had all you would expect in the way of amenities, tea making facilities, air con, heating, safe (not fixed though), TV and free WiFi. It was a little short of wardrobe space and my wife advises that you bring your own hairdryer. The bathroom, likewise a little lacking in storage space, had an excellent shower & washbasin and the water was always was hot. The toilet incorporated a small metal pipe serving as a bidet which is a little obtrusive when seated! The stars of the show were the staff ably led by Fatih Ozer. We were made to feel special, nothing was too much trouble, the rooms and stairs were impeccable, the breakfast buffet excellent. If you are the sort of tourist who is out most of the day then the Osmanhan is for you. If you like to laze around in a posh hotel with a restaurant, a bar and a lounge then look elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “great location and service”
Reviews.Author: jessica m
Reviews.Content: Excellent vacation, so sorry we have to check out now. Using the complimentary wifi to post a review, as we were so appreciative of the reviews that led us to choose this for our honeymoon in Istanbul. This is a hotel quite worthy of its very high reviews. The included breakfast is delicious and the view from the rooftop picturesque. We walked to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Archaeological Museums, Topkapi Palace, and even to a small boat dock for our Bosporus Cruise. We easily walked to the tram and took that to the funicular to visit Taksim Square for dinner and shopping and marveling at the crowds, as recommended by the incredibly helpful front desk person, Fatih, for our last night out. Two things should be noted to prepare potential future travelers: the single circular staircase leading to every room, and the roof terrace, is a tight spiral with only the wall on one side and a metal artsy rail on the other, but too far apart to hold both at once. And, the dense hotel and restaurant/bar location is great most of the time, but not great when asleep and guests of the neighboring hostel decide to stand outside and smoke and chat/yell/sing into the wee hours. Despite being temporarily awakened by this every night of our stay, I would highly recommend this hotel for its superb staff, ideal tourist location, and beautiful comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A place in the midst of the old city.”
Reviews.Author: ankitho
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the middle of old Istanbul. One can see all major sites on foot and there are plenty of restaurants around the corner. The staff is very friendly and vry helpful. Our room was small and on the first floor, so a bit noisy as we could of course hear the muezzin as well as a rooster greeting the early day light. yet all the amenities were well functioning( air condition shower, hot water). The room was very clean. breakfast was served on the roof terrace with a great view towards the Marmara sea and with a wonderful selection of cereal, fruits, eggs, cheeses and pastries. we stayed there for a total of 5 nights and were very well taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and friendly staff, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Paula K
Reviews.Content: I just spent a few days at the wonderful Osmanhan Hotel in Istanbul. It is in a great location - close to all the main tourist sites of Istanbul in a neighborhood with a charming and historic ambiance. The staff made me feel at home immediately and I knew I could count on them for great restaurant recommendations and other needs. The attention to detail at the Osmanham is second to none: all of the staff is friendly and accommodating. I enjoyed our conversations over cups of tea and the scrumptious and plentiful breakfast. The room was clean and spacious, with warm touches that made me feel at home. I highly recommend a trip to the Osmanham!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and charming”
Reviews.Author: BancroftBob
Reviews.Content: I am writing from this quaint and well-appointed boutique hotel. My wife and I are staying in the ground floor room, which is small but quite lovely. When we first walked in, it was like coming home, but better....there are little touches that speak to the special care the owners of this property have bestowed. The one I like best is the towel rack that keeps your towels warm! What can I say, Fatih has already been a great help in several ways, including helping me turn down the heat in the room. The charm of the place continues up to the rooftop terrace with it's amazing views. Everything the other readers have said is indeed true, and I simply can't imagine we could have found a finer spot at twice the price.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean, incredibly friendly”
Reviews.Author: EyesOnTheHorizon
Reviews.Content: I have little to add to others' reviews but just had to note what a great experience I had at Osman Han. Location is perfect for all sightseeing, rooms are clean and comfortable, breakfast was great, and Fatih was incredibly helpful. Cannot recommend highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: fkmAtlanta
Reviews.Content: The Osmanhan is a fantastic little hotel! The rooms are bright and clean, the location in Sultan Ahmet is perfect and close to "restaurant row," and the staff is eager to help in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Two Thumbs Up”
Reviews.Author: Trav69eller
Reviews.Content: Nothing but great things to say about OsmanHan Hotel. It's situated in a hopping part if town, with an easy walk to major historical sites. Fatih is one dedicated employee and was tremendously helpful to us.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for end of trip.”
Reviews.Author: EthelSue
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here at the end of our two week Turkey vacation. It was an ideal choice. The airport pickup was smooth and our room was ready when we arrived. Fatih is an excellent general manager. He answered all my questions as I made the reservation and after arrival. His English is excellent which is a real plus. We had room 32 which was of decent size and had a wonderfully strong, hot shower. The room was relatively quiet (no hotel room is silent). It was far more quiet than our other 3 options in Turkey. Breakfast was excellent with plenty of choice. The terrace overlooking the sea was an excellent spot to start the day. If you want to stay near all the tourist sites, this is a good choice. However, it is a busy area and you will be surrounded by tourists. We particularly enjoyed being able to walk down to the Maramar sea and walk along it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: bdruzin
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in this hotel and it was wonderful. We were picked up at the airport and brought to the hotel where our room was ready and waiting for us. The staff at the desk were always polite and helpful and very personable. The rooms were very clean and comfortable . Fatih in particular but all the staff were terrific. They gave us a laptop computer to use in our room every afternoon.The hotel is very well located within walking distance of the main sights such as the, the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, and Topkapi Palace. restaurants and to the tram stop.. No request was too much. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: wombat8250
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the ground floor double room for 2 nights. I was a bit worried about if the room was comfortable or not. But there was nothing to worry about. Our room was very clean and well organized. It was also quiet during the night time, so we could sleep very well. The breakfast was fabulous with the view of Marmara sea. The hotel is just 5 minutes walk from the Blue Mosque and the tram station. The most outstanding point of this hotel is the friendly staff, who made our stay comfortable. Fatih really helped us to travel the city with lots of information and advices. We will definitely come back!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Little Hotel in the Heart of It All”
Reviews.Author: sailsfca
Reviews.Content: The Osmanhan with its' 7 rooms feels more like a B&B than an impersonal hotel. Fatih (Fah-tee) in particular but all the staff were terrific. They went out of their way to help with all our requests be it extra pillows, suggestions on places to visit to arranging airport pick up for our friends staying at a different hotel !! As mentioned in the other reviews, location, breakfast, wifi, cleanliness are all first rate. Tip - Unless you are bushed and don't feel like walking, skip the restaurants near the hotel and check out the restaurants near and past the tram stop. Some are still a bit touristy but you will see more and more locals the further you go.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: A H
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in this hotel and really enjoyed it. The staff at the desk were always polite and helpful and very personable. The rooms were very clean and comfortable and the location is terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: AbdullahH
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and the service was exceptional. Thank you to Fatih for making us feel so welcomed. We really enjoyed our 4 days in Istanbul. I stayed at the Osmanhan Hotel and thoroughly enjoyed it. Even before arriving, the hotel helped us make transportation arrangements form and to the airport. From the minute we arrived, we felt welcomed by Fatih and the great staff, comfortable bed, very good a/c and windows that open, shower is very good. The Turkish breakfast is also very good and is served on the terrace which looks out to the Marmara sea and back to the mouth of the Bosphorus. We were surprised to find out that this hotel was very nice for money they were charging. The hotel is very well located within walking distance of the main sights of Istanbul, the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, and Topkapi Palace. restaurants and to the tram stop. Thank you, Fatih, for a great experience and for all the maps))) and I would gladly return!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great people, and would gladly return!”
Reviews.Author: preparetobeenvious
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Osmanhan Hotel as a part of a group and thoroughly enjoyed it. Even before arriving, the hotel helped us make transportation arrangements form the airport. From the minute we arrived, we felt welcomed by Fatih and the great staff. The hotel is located near a bazaar and is within easy walking distance of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, and Topkapi Palace. The Grand Bazaar is only slightly further. The hotel is also nestled within an extremely vibrant community filled with a variety of great restaurants from which to pick for lunch, dinner, or a mid-day refreshment. The hotel features a rooftop balcony/terrace for breakfast and it was also available for use in the evening to take in the view. Great spot to start or end the day. Thank you, Fatih, for a great experience and I would gladly return!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice and comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Gulliver42
Reviews.Content: My wife and me are from India, we are 68 and 65 years of age, we stopped in Istanbul for three nights on our way back from London.We had booked the hotel on the internet and hence were a little apprehensive, but every thing was just perfect, the hotel transport was waiting at the Airport even though the flight from London was two hours behind schedule. The breakfast was very good, we had the ground floor room and they even agreed to serve the breakfast in the room as my wife has difficulty climbing the stairs. Both Fatih and the owner Mustafa were very helpful and suggested the more important tourist sights. A good Budget hotel for any one. Pune India

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest hotel I encountered for many years of travel”
Reviews.Author: YUNG_HK
Reviews.Content: Central location, clean and beautifully decorated rooms, nice breakfast with a view on the rooftop, fast and free wifi (I am right now typing this at the room before checkout). And most outstanding of all, the friendliest staff team I have never met before. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, perfect breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: brigitteallison
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel from a guide book. Then my friends searched from internet and we decided to stay a couple days in Istanbul vacation. Location is very easy to reach main street. Breakfast was great! Everything was fresh and daily. We liked so much.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a special holiday!”
Reviews.Author: marinellka
Reviews.Content: Staying in Osmanhan hotel will help you to fully appreciate what a fantastic, magical place Istanbul is. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia and right next to a bustling street of touristy restaurants and bars which will give you a warm welcome if you do not want to venture out too far after a day of sightseeing. The staff are incredibly friendly and helpful, Fatih truly deserves his tripadvisor reputation! We chose this hotel from our shortlist on the strength of the pictures of the rooms and we were not disappointed. The rooms are beautifully decorated and spotless. The breakfast is served on a roof terrace with lovely views of the Bosphorus and I was looking forward to it every morning! A few types of cheese and bread, yogurt, olives, the most delicious tomatoes we've tasted and much more really gave it a local flavour. There is a metal staircase leading from the breakfast terrace to a smaller uncovered roof terrace. There are breathtaking views of the Blue Mosque minarets and the Bosphorous to be had and no one around. We went there on our wedding anniversary night (and a few nights afterwards!) with a glass of wine and just the two of us. One of the most romantic experiences we've ever had!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel on the edge of a "colorful neighborhood"”
Reviews.Author: HotelSnob2003
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Osmanhan for one nite post-cruise before our early flight home. Found the hotel on TA and booked a double, high floor for mid-July. The hotel is in an excellent location for site-seeing if you are in a hurry as we were. The young man at the front desk is the hotel's most helpful and endearing part of our stay - hello Fatih! Unfortunately for the Osmanhan, this would not be my choice for more than one night -- here's why: 1) The beds are stiff as a board -- typical, low-mid range hotel beds. 2) The street is peppered with youth-hostels, and our room was located right next to one with its glaring red sign glowing through our window all night long -- the hotel needs to invest in some black-out shades AND triple-glazing for noise! 3) At 4:30 AM, we were awakened by two men shouting and fighting as they tumbled out of one of the youth hostels across the street. Luckily, we had to leave early to catch a flight home! 4) Noisy -- no glazing on the windows and a decent thorofare with cab noise for a small ancient area of Istanbul -- ! Here are the good reasons to stay at the Osmanahan: 1) View from terrace. 2) Price. (If it's under $150 US) 3) Fatih and his helpfulness. 4) Serious air conditioning & stunning small bath. There are so many hotels in Istanbul, especially in the historic centre -- shop, before you buy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: AdvisemeNZ
Reviews.Content: You won't regret this choice. We stayed in this hotel for the last 5 nights of our month long visit around Turkey. The location is excellent. The hotel is very clean, good sized comfortable rooms, comfortable bed, very good a/c and windows that open, shower is very good. Coffe/tea maker in the room (which is really important for us). The Turkish breakfast is also very good and is served on the terrace which looks out to the Marmara sea and back to the mouth of the Bosphorus. One of the best things about this hotel is the staff - they are top quality. A youngish but very mature staff who all aim to provide top quality service. They are all very courteous, friendly and helpful. Fatih, who is on the reception desk during the day, is superb. He has a wonderful genuine friendly and very helpful manner. He makes you feel very welcome without being intrusive. He would be a top asset to any establishment which values quality customer service. The owners are always present at breakfast, it is a nice touch because they make a point of helping to serve the breakfast tables. I guess it is their way of keeping in touch with the running of the hotel and making sure the guests are being well catered for. We would definitely stay here again and highly recommend this hotel to any friends or family visiting this wonderful city in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms, Great Staff, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: monkeyman1628
Reviews.Content: This summer my wife and I stayed at the Osmanhan Hotel for four days while in Istanbul. We were incredibly impressed with our choice. We were looking for a bit more expensive hotel to spend the night in than our usual budget or hostel accommodations and we were definitely not disappointed! Our room was beautiful, with air conditioning, a hot water pot, and an extremely comfortable bed! The two men who ran the front desk were always so friendly and welcoming no matter what time we came back at and complimentary breakfast was a great way to start the day. The breakfast was Turkish with fruit, olives, two types of breads, yogurt, and choice of coffee or tea (Turkish or regular). In addition, we were also very impressed by the hotel's location in Sultanahmet. The Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia, and streetcar stop are all a 5 minute walk away. The hotel is somewhat difficult to find but local shopkeepers sitting outside were all very nice and helped us find our way from the streetcar stop. Note: For dinner don't hang around Sultanamet (very touristy and expensive) but walk over near the Spice Bazaar and poke around. If you really want to know the good places to eat pick up the book "Istanbul Eats: Exploring the Culinary Backstreets" for some great recommendations. Osmanhan Hotel is the place to stay in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Baur-1-2
Reviews.Content: We were surprised to find out that this hotel was very nice for money they were charging. People working there are very friendly. Nice breakfast with good view of marmara sea. Location is good, in the center of old city within the walking distance from main attractions. Eventhough we checked out from hotel, they allowed to keep our luggage for another hald day in their hotel while we were doing sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice people in an excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaryMakdisi
Reviews.Content: It is a very nice clean hotel, staff are very helpful and friendly, and the neighborhood is lovely. I stayed there for two days and I will next year because it felt like home. Thank you Fatih.(for all the maps:) )

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet hotel in a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: serenalroth
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at Osmanhan Hotel in Istanbul. The room was very comfortable with a good bed and nice bathroom, and surprisingly very quiet given its central location. The breakfasts on the rooftop deck were outstanding, and the view of the Bosphorus is unbeatable. The front desk staff, especially Fatih, were so helpful and friendly, and made us feel very at home. The hotel is within 5 minutes walk of key sites like the Aya Sophia and Blue Mosque, great shopping, and the tram. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT~!”
Reviews.Author: VinterBug
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights when I first arrived in Istanbul back in June. Glad to have chosen this hotel as my first shut-eye option in Turkey as the excellent staff and nice, quiet room helped me settle into the new destination greatly. Double room that I stayed is very nice, clean, comfortable and had a luxury feel to it. Price is slightly more expensive than other accommo options around Sultanahmet but still it was worth it. The rooftop breakfast room serves the nicest in-house (included) breakfast that I've come across during my entire stay in Turkey. Fatih and staff are very very friendly, helpful and welcoming. Will definitely stay there again next time when I'm in Istanbul~!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in a quaint hotel; excellent service”
Reviews.Author: rashriva
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Osmanhan Hotel in Istanbul with our baby daughter for 7 days in May 2011. We had a wonderful time and felt very welcome at this hotel. All the staff paid attention to detail and went out of their way to make sure we and our baby were comfortable, to the extent that the owner even offered to let us borrow his daughter's bath tub to bathe our baby. We ended up showering her, but it was a very nice gesture nonetheless. The property itself is converted from a house, and is small and narrow and built up on several stories. The rooms are well appointed, clean, and decorated traditionally. There is no elevator and the stairs spiral up, with 2 rooms on each floor. On the top floor is the beautiful rooftop terrace where the excellent breakfast is served. We have very fond memories of enjoying leisurely breakfasts on that terrace, munching on the delicious spread and chatting with Mustafa, the co-owner. The breakfast spread usually included simit (Turkish bagel-like pastry with sesame seeds), breads, cheese, tomato, cucumber, eggs, fruits, yogurt, and a delicious rose petal jam. There were many highlights of our stay at Osmanhan - one of them happened about 5 days into our stay. We had checked out of the hotel after breakfast to go and spend 4 nights visiting Selcuk, Ephesus, and Cesme before returning to Istanbul for another 2 nights at Osmanhan. Although there were many taxis outside the hotel, Mustafa insisted on calling a taxi for us from a reputable taxi company, which he said was more reliable than the taxis outside. We loaded up our luggage and baby and went off to the airport for our domestic flight. An hour later when we landed in Izmir I realized that my cell phone was missing, and deduced that it must have fallen out in the trunk of the taxi. We called Osmanhan Hotel and explained the situation to Fatih at the front desk. Fatih made a couple of quick calls and located my phone, then called us back and told us he would hold on to it until we returned to Istanbul, and told us to relax and enjoy our time on the coast. Imagine how happy I was to find my phone waiting for me in the hotel safe when we came back to Osmanhan 4 days later! :) Without Mustafa calling for a taxi for us, and without Fatih working with the taxi company to track down my phone, it definitely would have been lost that day. Osmanhan's Sultanahmet location is great - within short walking distance to most of the old town's historic sights, as well as the Sultanahmet tram stop, which provides easy access to other parts of the city. The whole Sultanahmet district is pretty touristy, but it's also quaint and convenient. We have such fond memories of Osmanhan hotel and Istanbul... watching the sun set over the minarets of the Blue Mosque, rambling over the cobblestones back to the hotel after busy days of exploring, the warmth of the Turks as they played with our baby... we can't wait to return and visit again one day!

Reviews.Title: “excellent and wonderful”
Reviews.Author: baldricing
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights,found this hotel on TA.,very nice hotel,clean,comfortable,The hotel itself is beautiful. The service was excellent and breakfast every morning was wonderful.we will come back

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: chrissy50
Reviews.Content: I can't speak highly enough. Fatih who is just about always on the front desk goes out of his way to help you with just about anything. There are 2 main things I want in a Hotel room and that is a really good bed and a great shower, our room's had both. I say our room's as due to a mistake on my part we arrived a day early, Fatih solved the problem. He was able to give us a Standard room and the next day move us into the Delux that we had booked. The bed and shower were the same in both. You could eat off the floor the hotel is so clean, everyone smiles and you feel so at home. The breakfast is not huge but it is delicious, there are only 7 rooms in the whole hotel and we loved looking at the Bosphorus while eating, the breakfast area is on the top floor and you can choose to eat inside or outside

Reviews.Title: “Small friendly hotel in Sultanhamet”
Reviews.Author: Lynne056
Reviews.Content: Osmanhan Hotel with only 7 rooms is comfortable, friendly and the location is perfect for exploring many of the historic sites by foot. Get the hang of the tram and you can get to most other places on the must-do list. Fatih, the manager is the perfect host with help and advice and a lovely, friendly manner. Some travel books suggest that you should get out of the Sultanhamet area to find good restaurants but we ate at two gems right on the Osmanhan doorstep. "Balikci Sabahattin". is a very good fish restaurant which changed our resolve not to eat fish away from NZ where it is so good, as the grilled sea bass and seafood mezze here were fresh and tasty. The other was "Cooking Alaturk", where I also did a very enjoyable cooking class that finished with the participants eating the delicious four couse meal together. The very good breakfast on the terrace with views over the Sultanhamet area and the Bospherous, was a nice start to the day. We would love to stay here again on a future visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, spotless, helpful staff, intimate”
Reviews.Author: adventuressCA
Reviews.Content: Loved staying here (was also at Obelisk which we disliked). Staff so friendly and welcoming. There is real pride of ownership at this hotel. Looked recently remodeled and it was done with quality--double paned windows which is key as area is so noisy. Perfectly comfortable room. Breakfast is basic. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendly, helpful staff, great value”
Reviews.Author: Jennyanneherre
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small, family-run, and recently opened (with a terrific shower ) . A personable staff bends over backwards to be accommodating. As an old Turkey traveller, I think this hotel is the perfect place to stay for a few days of sight-seeing in Istanbul. Be advised that there is no elevator, and the stairs are steep. The view from the roof ((breakfast room) is worth the climb!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: SpachNZ
Reviews.Content: Before staying at this hotel, I was impressed. I got comprehensive and friendly answers to my emails within 30 minutes and often quicker! A really great place to stay in Istanbul. This is a small hotel with only 7 rooms. The staff are all very friendly and Fatih (on the front desk) has very good English and was always there to welcome us back and have a friendly chat with. Breakfast is included in the price and is served on the roof terrace. Really good location, about 5 minutes walk to the Arasta Bazaar and Blue Mosque and a little bit further to the Aya Sofya. Located within 2 minutes walk from many great restaurants. There is free fast WiFi. We used the airport pick-up service organised by the hotel and were met a the airport and driven directly to the hotel by a friendly driver who pointed out the sights on the way in and offered as water to drink. I want to return to Istanbul, just to have the pleasure of staying at this hotel again :-)

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Rishirajg
Reviews.Content: Really small boutique hotel in the heart of the tourist area (Sultanahmet) but on a quiet street. The hotel has only 7 rooms and makes the stay very warm and personal. The biggest benefit is the friendly front desk guy who speaks very good english and is always helpful (thanks Fatih). He has some very useful suggestions for everthing and tries to accomodate every request. Breakfast is prety good and the breads are delicious. About 10 min walk from blue mosque/Aya Sofia and the palace, excellent location. The free WiFi is also an added bonus and the speed is very good. Only downside was the size of the room for the price you pay in peak season and the lack of elevator, but the helpful staff definitely makes up for that.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: mdibden
Reviews.Content: The Osmanhan is a great hotel - it is clean, it's in a quiet area, it has wonderful staff, the terrace is amazing and the location is perfect. All round, highly recommended. You'd have to go a long way to beat this place.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: walter1326
Reviews.Content: Our seven day stay at the Osmanhan Hotel was wonderful. It is in the Sultanahment District with a rooftop view of the Blue Mosque and overlooking the Bosphorus . My husband enjoys drawing, and it was a perfect place to sketch. The staff were helpful in every possible way. It is impeccably clean and comfortable. The breakfasts were perfect. You will be lucky to get a reservation. We will book ahead on our next trip. March is low season, but we met people from all over the world. What a wonderful Istanbul experience staying at the Osmanhan Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect - Turkish hospitality from A to Z”
Reviews.Author: IsabelandCarine
Reviews.Content: Although the weather was horrible (snow, storm and rain), we had a sunny stay in Istanbul, thanks to owner Mustafa, Fatih and Mehmet.... Their hospitality and sunny personalities made our trip perfect. Fatih was always there to answer any type of question and we felt like coming home at night, after dwelling around in the city all day. Location: just 2 minutes walking from the Blue Mosque and Agia Sophia Breakfast: all you need - what a view (in summer, possibility to sit on the roof terrace) Friendliness: the owner himself comes to greet you at breakfast and the receptionist Fatih is extremely helpful with suggestions and information on sights, shopping and restaurants Spotless! Perfect duvets We booked the transfers from and to the airport through the hotel and it was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Very well refurbished hotel in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: elpidoforos
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel close to ... everyhting. Personnel was very kind, rooms were very clean and nice, location was exellent, just minor noise from the street during the night. Definately recommendable. TIP: Beware of the Turkish Taxi drivers ...

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful stay in a fantastic & clean hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Fiza
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband & 8 month daughter from 10-15 March 2011 in this wonderful hotel. Room We had a 1 double bed & 1 single bed, shower/toilet. It's very clean & you can choose to open the windows or the aircon. Location Blue mosque, Topkapi Palace, AyaSofia, Grand/Spice Bazaar & lots other attractions are all within easy walking distance. Food eateries is all around the corners, just have your pick. Staff Last but not least, thank you for Ahmet & Fatih to arrange room, all the hotel transfers & even help to buy the bday cake for my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible value, off the chart”
Reviews.Author: MrSinjow
Reviews.Content: My second visit to the Osmanhan, the second review I've ever written (guess for what hotel i wrote the first review). I wondered if I would be as impressed as I was after my first visit. They treated me like family; always greeted by the owner, taken to dinner by the owner's brother, more great recommendations from Fatih (the best customer service person I've ever encountered). The Osmanhan simply does everything right. Have you noticed that they NEVER have had a bad or even fair review? Perhaps only a hundred hotels in the entire world can say that. The location is the best, the rooms are smart and clean, everyone in their employ is friendly and helpful and the value is just incredible. Before I stayed in the Osmanhan, I did not believe any such hotel existed. They have become my special friends in Istanbul. What will they do for my next visit?? I look forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, clean, friendly, great value”
Reviews.Author: holidayadvisor79
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at this hotel and it was fantastic. We had airport transfers, easy check in. Very clean. Great breakfast. Incredibly friendly and helpful staff who couldn't have made the stay more enjoyable. Also great location as you can walk to the main sights really easily and there are lots of restaurants nearby. We found it really easy to go out into the main town at night to go to the bars, as the taxis were pretty reasonable. Free wi-fi too if you have your own phone/laptop which is handy for looking up websites of venues to see what's on.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel,,”
Reviews.Author: santafetrailguy
Reviews.Content: It is close by the all the museum,Blue Mosque,Hogia Sophia,Topkapi Palace and the other place is... Also ha got great sea view from the roof top and my room as well.. Very safe area and friendly stuff.. Thanks very much for your hospitalty...Highly recomended this lovely a litt Hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Look no further for a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jameswoodap
Reviews.Content: My wife, our 2 year old and I stayed at the Osmanhan in mid January. 2 weeks before we arrived, we received email correspondence from Fatih regarding transport to and from the airport. It was taken care of flawlessly. We stayed in the triple room, which was a little tight because of the third bed, but if you go to Istanbul to spend all day in your room, then just stay home. The beds were very comfortable and we slept well. There is no elevator, and the steps are tight, but they will take care of your luggage. Osmanhan is very close to all of the main attractions of Sultanhamet. They are less than 10 minutes walk. There are some very tasty restaurants just around the corner and Fatih can recommend the best places. Just a note about Fatih, he is simply awesome. He can help arrange tours, transportation, recommend food, give advice on customs and prepare you for the "guides" who really want to sell you a rug. He really was the most helpful person we dealt with on our entire trip to 3 different countries. The food for breakfast was excellent and plentiful. The terrace dining room provides great views of the Bosporus and you can see the minarets of the blue mosque as well. One of the nicest things that happened was at the end of our stay. Our airport pickup was not to arrive until 4 PM and checkout was noon. Mustafa, the owner allowed us to keep our room until departure so our daughter could have a much needed nap. Thank you Mustafa, Fatih and Osmanhan, I will recommend you to anyone I know traveling to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “So friendly, clean, welcoming and central for the major sites”
Reviews.Author: gillybarwick
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights in January. We arranged through the hotel to be picked up at the airport and were greeted on time and transferred to the hotel in a very smart mini-bus just for ourselves with complimentary drinks. Upon arriving at the hotel we were greeted by Ahmed and shown to our room. It was much larger than we had anticipated for a city centre hotel bedroom, well appointed and spotlessly clean. The breakfast was included in the price and was a good selection of breads, meat, cheese, cereal, fruit, with tea, coffee and fruit juices. There really is nothing to fault with this hotel and we were especially appreciative of Fatih's friendliness and tips on where to go and what to do in Istanbul. We would definately stay here again and will certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Samopeth
Reviews.Content: The staff was professional and very kind and cooperative . The location is excellent and it is within a walking distance to all the major attractions in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “it is a lovely place:)))”
Reviews.Author: eagleVA
Reviews.Content: I stayed this hotel in november almost a week and the people who is working there were very nice. The hotel is a great location close by the Blue Mosque,Hogia Sophia and all the important place to see it.. thanks for your hospitality and see you nex time ,,,,,,

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: happytravel19
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is perfect, couldn't be better. The service from the hotel was fantastic. All the information provided was very helpful. It is best service from hotel I have ever had. The room itself is not thing fancy, but very clean. The breakfast was simple, but nice and clean. My wife and I was very happy been there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, execellent breakfast with magnificent views and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Fairgrieve75
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right next to all the important sights in Istanbul. They serve an execellent continental breakfast served on the rooftop terrace with beautiful views over the Bospherus. Friendly staff and a very safe neighborhood makes this hotel great value for money. Within easy walking distance to the tram that enables easy access to airport via metro. Nice running route available just head towards the coast (2mins) and follow the coast a couple of km and turn left into the park which leads to Blue Mosque and back to Hotel. 4 km route and very peaceful running between the great Mosque and Hagia Sofia early in the morning when the streets are empty.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kurt077
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Osmanhan Hotel for 8 nights last month. It was my first visit to Istanbul. This hotel was terrific for us: clean, quiet, a great value, and located within easy walking distance to most of the major sites. We also found the staff to be extraordinarily helpful, from arranging an airport pickup to offering restaurant suggestions to arranging breakfast bags to take with us in the cab for a very early morning return flight. The staff just made us feel at home. The room was extremely comfortable and quiet. Breakfast was plentiful and the view from the terrace was outstanding. They really do a great job. We are already planning our next trip to Istanbul and look forward to staying again at Osmanhan Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything a hotel should be and more!”
Reviews.Author: Rowan91
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel. The bed was unbelievably comfortable; the breakfast was delicious; the views were fab; the cost is so reasonable for what you get; and Fati, on the desk, was really helpful on every aspect of our trip (including where to buy toothpaste because we forgot to pack it!). Also really close to all the best sites, and some lovely restaurants. Couldn't recommend this highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Best service in all my years of travel.”
Reviews.Author: Mawuli89
Reviews.Content: Our family lives overseas and we travel extensively. We decided to stay here based on tripadvisor reviews and were not disappointed. The rooms are clean, have complimentary items, cable TV and free wireless. The location is excellent, less than 5 minutes from the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya, Arasta Bazar and Topkapi palace. It is off of a main road, so it is accessible without the noise of Istanbul nightlife. What makes it so special is the people that work there. Fatih is enormously helpful and the owners are at breakfast every day to greet you. If you are hungry in the evening or at any time during the day, they welcome you to go to the balcony breakfast kitchen for complimentary tea, coffee, fruit or whatever else you want to help yourself to. Breakfast is included and is fresh everyday and has something for everyone. Whatever we needed, Fatih took care of us. I had a misfortunate incident where my front tooth broke and he immediately found me a dentist that was able to take care of me and the price was extremely reasonable. Fatih looked into our million and one requests, and was always kind and helpful, going out of his way to make sure we were taken care of. The owners of the hotel are also hands on, with the owner offering to personally take me to the hospital to go to the dentist. You do not get this treatment from all hotels, and certainly not one in a large city such as Istanbul. We have two very active boys and the hotel was extremely accommodating. When we return we will stay here again, as we felt embraced and well taken care of throughout our stay.

Reviews.Title: “amaazing service”
Reviews.Author: hakkan
Reviews.Content: I visited this nice hotel on the way back from my business meeting in Ankara.They were allways tidy,very clean and stuff are helpfull every time.

Reviews.Title: “The nicest hotel I've ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: sunnidafl
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. From our first contact, the entire staff was dedicated to their guests needs and comfort. Location was excellent-quick walk to the Blue Mosque and Ayasofia, Easy walk to Topkapi Palace, Galata Bridge. Many cafes and shops in the neighborhood of the hotel. We felt safe walking at night and no one hassled us. We used the hotel's airport transport service which worked perfectly. The wonderful young man at the front desk spoke excellent English Our room was nicely appointed with an excellent bathroom and shower. Breakfast was in an enclosed rooftop room with a bird's eye view of Istanbul The breakfast was varied and the staff prepared us fresh coffee and tea every morning. If I return to Istanbul, this will be my hotel. The entire staff should be highly commended.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful service, great breakfast/view and the best sleep I've had in months!”
Reviews.Author: MyOpinion89
Reviews.Content: I've never bothered to write a TripAdvisor review before, so the fact that I'm doing so proves that this hotel was something special! The 5* review is largely based on the brilliant staff, who went out of their way to be friendly and helpful... in addition to which the room was pretty, well-kept and the breakfast was a definite winner!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and convenient location in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Lambert B
Reviews.Content: Very small (7 room) hotel in old Istanbul. Walking distance to Blue Mosque, Haya Sofya and Topkapi. Friendly service, Fati the regular front desk clerk is very helpful and knowledgeable. The rooms are a reasonable size and clean. Shower/washroom up to date. Flat screen tv and free wireless internet. On the downside, single room on the main floor is right behind reception so not the most private and at the side is below the floor level for the sloping street beside it so not for the light sleepers. Excellent breakfast with many fresh breads/cheeses and other items served on the roof top terrace which gives you a beautiful view of the surrounding area and the Golden Horn/Asia Easiest way to get there is take Metro from airport, change to tram on T1 line and get off at Sultanahmet stop, then walk to hotel...the last part is a bit tricky if you have lots of luggage, then take taxi in street at Sultanahmet stop as you will go down the cobble stoned streets. I asked the hotel to put a better map on the site on how to walk there because street names are not easily visible in Turkey, ask for Arista bazaar then walk down the street leading down from it , then ask someone

Reviews.Title: “Good price/value, very clean and friendly, excellent braekfast on roof terrace”
Reviews.Author: Piesses
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in this hotel, which is in the center of Sultanahmet, close to the 'things to visit' on a first stay in Istanbul. It is located at the corner of a reasonably quiet street for this area. During the evening and night we could hear the neighbours on the stairs and in their room quite well, so you have to be lucky that the other visitors in the hotel are decent and quiet people. Breakfast was perfect on the nice roof terrace (outside or inside). People were very friendly. Very clean Overall: good hotel, espacially considering the price; noise level could be a little bit anoying for some geasts.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Owner!”
Reviews.Author: theway02
Reviews.Content: Agree with everyone that the hotel is conveniently located and boasts a great rooftop for breakfast (most hotels in that area do though) and very comfortable and clean rooms. I loved to cut through the Blue Mosque on my way to the hotel after a day of sightseeing and to sit on the rooftop admiring the glittering lights across the Sea of Marmara. But the most memorable part of the hotel was the owner who was the most sincere and helpful host. He spent half a day taking us to the Grand Bazaar and Spice Market and negotiated on everything we bought - there was no way the average tourist could get the deals he got for us! His English was good and we immensely enjoyed his company while having lunch under the Galata Bridge. On another day, the owner graciously drove us to a locals only kebab restaurant and we had a fantastic meal. Fatih who worked at the front desk spoke perfect English and was genuinely friendly and resourceful. One of my favorite experiences in Turkey was meeting the incredible people but these two guys really stood out above everyone else.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute gem in a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: PeterEloise
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic welcome we received in this wonderful little hotel. The location is ideal to explore on foot the best of what Istanbul has to offer. The rooms are large, spotlessly clean and superbly finished, the view from the rooms and the rooftop terrace magnificent and the help , advice and service in general was outstanding in every respect. Fatih's local restaurant recommendations were perfect for our needs. We certainly cannot wait to return. This hotel is streets ahead of any other hotel we have experienced in Istanbul and, at the price, is a real bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Right choice for me”
Reviews.Author: coach1956
Reviews.Content: Based on Trip Advisor reviews, I booked five nights at this small, lovely, hotel. Four at the beginning of my trip, and one at the end. It was a perfect choice. First of all, Fatih, who works the front desk is exceptionally sweet and helpful. His English was very good (English is the only language I speak fluently); we communicated via e mail and I called once. Every question was answered with kindness and patience. The rooms are very clean, nicely decorated, and cozy; and I think I remember that the beds were comfortable. I would have liked a little more surface space in the room and bathroom, but, really, I was hardly in my room so it wasn't a big deal. The food at the hotel is standard to many hotels; it was good and enough, and the two young women working the kitchen friendly and helpful. The rooftop view isn't much, but again, I didn't spend much time at the hotel and didn't care. The location is good. I could walk everywhere, and did. My first full day in Istanbul I asked Fatih if he knew someone who would show me around for about an hour, get me acclimated. A man who was standing next to me at that moment said he would take me around. He was Hamit, the owner! He took me to a museum and acted as a private tour guide, took me to a top rated (by Lonely Planet) a bit off the beaten track restaurant, and of course, to his carpet shop where I had several cups of tea. Hamit may be unusual in that he didn't push me to buy, nor does he send people out to hussle you into his shop. At the end of my Turkey travel I was happy to come back for one night before catching a morning flight. It felt like coming "home." The only downside to this charming hotel and staff is the noise from the street and late nighters who were probably hostelers. But, my earplugs mostly took care of that. I wonder how many areas of the Sultanahmet area are noisy, as it is a bustling city. Istanbul is a fantastic; the people lovely. My only regret is not having spent more than five days in Istanbul. There's so much to see! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Staff and Location”
Reviews.Author: Gricper
Reviews.Content: Found this place on Tripadvisor and it totally lived up to it's billing. We stayed for three nights in July. The hotel organised an airport transfer for us and the staff couldn't have been more helpful with restaurant recomendations and trip bookings. The room was lovely and the breakfst delightful with plenty of choice in a superb rooftop location. The hotel is ten minutes walk from all the main sites and a few minutes from a bustling street with a good choice of restaurants and bars. Not only all this but its good value for money too.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly small hotel with good location to sights of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: havacar
Reviews.Content: Friendly, good service, clean, breakfast served on rooftop with view. Great Staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel that we recommend to anyone”
Reviews.Author: barneyrubble3
Reviews.Content: We were in Istanbul in Sept. 2010 for a combination business/leisure trip and our stay at the Osmanhan during the leisure part of our trip was wonderful. When our luggage was lost on our arrival in Istanbul, the Osmanhan staff took over calling the airlines and facilitated delivery. When we traveled outside of Istanbul, they allowed us to leave most of our luggage there for free. Wireless internet and the continental breakfast were included. We enjoyed sitting on the rooftop terrace for breakfast. The staff were particularly friendly and helpful, giving great directions to the local attractions as well as great restaurants just around the corner. All of this was in complete contrast to the Hilton Istanbul where we stayed for the business part of our trip and who were continually trying to charge us for anything above and beyond our initial reservation. In hindsight, we should have spent all of our nights in Istanbul at the Osmanhan and took the local train back and forth for our business meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location. Just 5 minutes...”
Reviews.Author: kevlee69
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location. Just 5 minutes from blue mosque n aya sofya. About 10 min walk to the metro. Rooms very clean. Nice roof terrace for breakfast with sea views. For this price, can't get better value.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the warm welcome and fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Fairfield92
Reviews.Content: Thank you for your hospitality, we had a fantastic stay and loved the location - near all the attractions and good restaurants around the corner. The breakfast was delicious - thanks so much for the gift of the rose jam - my children appreciated it! We will recommend you and hope to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and extremely helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: roaming_london
Reviews.Content: The Osmanhan Hotel is perfectly located, should you wish to stay in the old district of Sultanhamet. The Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia and Topkapi Palace are all close by. In fact, most of the main tourist attractions are but a walking distance away. I found the staff both extremely helpful and polite. Nothing was too much trouble for them. The rooms were spotless, the mini bar well stocked and the breakfast was great. Incidentally, breakfast is served from a lovely roof top restaurant, overlooking the Bosporus! I couldn't recommend the Osmanhan highly enough and it will be my hotel of choice, were I to go back to Istanbul for a third time!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Modern, Great Location, Recommended Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chernd00
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Osmanhan hotel in Istanbul. The room was nice and modern with air conditioning and an updated bathroom. Nice flat screen TV. They had free wireless internet. The desk clerk was friendly and we did not have a language barrier. We enjoyed a great included breakfast on the rooftop terrace each morning. The airline lost my suitcase, and the clerk was helpful in following up to get the bag delivered to the hotel. The stairs are very narrow and steep (no elevator) and he also had the bag brought up to our room. Few minor issues â€“ the hotel is not located on the street of its address (Akbiyik). We had some trouble finding it. Itâ€™s on the third side street on Akbiyik. It is only about a 10 minute walk from the Sultanahmet tram stop. We had no trouble taking the metro and tram from the airport and saving on cab fare. Another minor issue was one day we asked for a wake up call and didnâ€™t get it. We woke up 2 hours later. Luckily we didnâ€™t have travel that day, just sightseeing, but suggest that other travelers set a back-up alarm. Lastly, beware of rolling blackouts. We came back one night and there was no power. It came back on within an hour. Suggest bringing a small flashlight. The hotel is close to all the major sites in Istanbul: Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Archaeological Museum, Basilica Cistern, Grand Bazzar, etc. We were not impressed with the Hop On Hop Off bus tour. Liked the Bosphorus Cruise. Definitely recommend the Osmanhan Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “ItÂ´s really a hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: KattiMalmoe
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel with a superb staff in a great area with walkingdistance to all sightseeings in Sultanahmet area.The hotel only has 7 rooms so you get very close to the staff and some guests and the rooms are in a good size and cleaned every day and they even change towels.
