The hotel also have a roofterrace where you can sit and have your own whine or beer in the evenings and relax with a great view and down under it, itÂ´s where the breakfast is served with balconyview. You can even see The Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia from the roofterrace. I would definitly recommend this hotel to anyone. Thank you Fathi (hope I spelled it right) and the rest of you (the staff) that maked our trip special.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel at excellent value right in the historical centre of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: sebn_1983
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights and enjoyed the stay here. The room was well presented and the breakfast (included) on the roof terrace was a great way to start the day. The staff were very helpful and the location was excellent for those looking to see all that old Istanbul has to offer. At this price level easily the best place i have ever stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: HiromiK
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here with my husband and my father. The room was clean and breakfast was good. The roof terrace of this hotel has a great view! All staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great service, very pleased all round”
Reviews.Author: MollyandTony
Reviews.Content: The Osmanhan is situated moments away from the Blue Mosque and Sultanahmet Square. This is the ideal place to stay to visit the major sites. It is close to a buzzy street lined with nice cafes and restaurants but tucked away so you are not disturbed by the noise. In fact it's very quiet indeed. The bed was comfortable and the room and bathroom extremely clean and well kept. Breakfast is on the roof terrace with a great view out to the Marmara Sea. Fatih and his colleagues are helpful and friendly and work very hard to make your stay easy and enjoyable - he even made us sandwiches the morning we were leaving as we left too early for breakfast! There is no lift so if stairs are a problem it could be tricky as you have to get to the top for breakfast - the view is worth it though. I would heartily recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comfortable, clean, great location - what else do you need?”
Reviews.Author: Howard_Wright
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Osmanhan based on the excellent reviews here, and because it was a small family run hotel in a very good location. We loved it - beautiful rooms, very well maintained, friendly and helpful staff, lovely breakfasts from the rooftop. If we travel to Istanbul again this will be our first choice. We booked our room just a day before we arrived in Istanbul (we didn't know in advance when we would arrive). We were offered a triple room at the price of a standard double, so we got a very good deal. The room was excellent - very clean and comfortable, air conditioning, nice bathroom with a very good shower. The bed was nice and firm and we slept VERY well. Even if we'd had the double room (rather than the triple at no extra charge) I think we would have felt just as comfortable. The hotel is situated in the heart of the historic part of Istanbul, a few minutes walk from Agia Sofia, the Blue Mosque and Topkapi palace. It's on a quiet backstreet corner, just 50 metres or so from a busier road full of restaurants and small shops. Although this street is fairly lively in the evenings, there is very little noise or traffic on the street where the hotel is. To get to the metro is about 5 minutes walk (near Agia Sofia), and you can also walk to a station on the older train line near the coast in a few minutes. In terms of location, it is very well placed. All the staff are extremely friendly, speak good or excellent English, and can advise on places to go to eat or to visit. Breakfast is served on the rooftop terrace, with views towards the Blue Mosque and the Bosphorus. You can choose from a buffet which offers delicious fresh bread and rolls, cheeses, jams, fresh fruit, cucumber, tomato, fruit juices, yoghurt, eggs, tea/coffee and more. It's genuinely hard to think of anything much at the hotel that was lacking or needed improving. Having a small safe in the room might be a useful addition, and there was only one parasol on the rooftop terrace to give some shade (it can be hot even at 9am). Apart from those minor details, everything you need is there for you. I think the reason for success of this hotel is that it is small (8 rooms), family run, and well maintained by a small team of excellent, friendly staff, so you are very well looked after. We would love to go back to Istanbul, and hope we can book again at the Osmanhan.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly and helpful staff, good rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Zepaniah
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the heart of the old city and within walking distance of most of the attractions.Use the shuttle transfer service to get you to and from the airport, its much cheaper than a taxi and you can arrange it from the airport/hotel. During breakfast on the rooftop where you can admire the view of the Sea across the red tiled rooves, you will probably be joined by the inquistive doves. There is no lift in the hotel so if this is going to be an issue for you you may need to consider other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel in a Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTravelingNow
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for two nights in August 2010. It has a prime location - close to the Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia, and Topkapi Palace - but is on a quieter side street that allowed for peaceful sleeping and a lovely breakfast on the rooftop terrace with sea views. The staff was helpful and kind. The room was not particularly spacious, but was well appointed, and the shower was great!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: kiwiwords
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel & location - Blue Mosque & Topkapi Palace within easy walking distance - small hotel with friendly staff. Comfortable & clean. Airport pickup was well organised & prompt.

Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: ir_wintergarden
Reviews.Content: At first this small family run hotel in Sultanahmet looks like many others in the area. Look closely and you get a spotless and comfortable room (mine was almost at street level but I never had any noise issues), nice bathroom, good breakfast (plus great views from the rooftop room) and, mainly, a very friendly service from the staff. This is really the major selling point of the hotel as previous reviewers have already stated many times. Fatih in particular is truly fantastic. The location is ideal for first-time visitors to Istanbul. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves its 100% satisfaction rating”
Reviews.Author: Manytrips
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exactly as advertised in the reviews. The staff is amazingly friendly and everything is spotless. The view from the rooftop is wonderful. The breakfast is good. The hotel is excellent value for money: It is not expensive and hence the rooms are fairly small. The location is very central to the main tourist sights and there are innumerable restaurant options within a block or two. We had an early flight the last day and the staff prepared a breakfast package with juice and a breakfast sandwich to take along.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and well located hotel with helpful friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ebruhack
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay here, the room was a really good size for the price and clean, the bathroom was very nice and breakfast on the terrace every morning with a lovely view was great. It's in a easy walking distance from all the main tourist attractions and the staff are really friendly and helpful. Would definately recommend this.

Reviews.Title: “I'm glad we stayed at OsmanHan.”
Reviews.Author: barbara960
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 2 night stay here. The location is within walking distance of all the major sites in Sultanahmet, and just off a street with many restaurants and shops. The room was spotless and spacious enough, with a modern bathroom, little refrigerator, and free wifi. The owner and employees were extremely pleasant and helpful. They served an above average breakfast on their rooftop overlooking the Bosphorus. All in all, we recommend this nice hotel in the hear of old Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “excellent staff and location!”
Reviews.Author: TokyoNatto
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Osmanhan Hotel during my 5 days trip in Turkey. Fast e-mail replies, and welcoming atmosphere. Loved the roof terrace breakfast and the cosy family-like atmosphere. Especially, I was impressed by the friendly and super helpful staff. They speak good English with full of hospitality. During my short trip to Cappadocia, I forgot my hat in the night bus, and I could not have it back during my stay in Istanbul. No one in Cappadocia was helpful enough, but Osmanhan hotel was different. They were so kind; talked to the bus company and made an arrangement to have my hat sent back to Istanbul!! Then they send my hat to Tokyo, where I live. It was a miracle! Also, I had to leave the hotel very early on my departure day. Front desk made an arrangement for a breakfast; sandwiches and an apple! I did not ask for that. It was so kind. Only 7 rooms, not a big hotel, but very comfortable and you can feel very safe. Easy access to major sightseeing place and many restaurants, but you can sleep very well. You can have a payment discount if you pay in cash. When I am coming back to Istanbul, I would like to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: leahamanda
Reviews.Content: There are not enough good things to say about this hotel in Sultanahmet. We already want to return as we loved the place and its location and staff. Fatih was extremely and friendly and made us feel very welcome in the hotel. The rooms were modern, clean, and comfortable. The hotel is located just blocks from excellent restaurants and tourist sights. We had an excellent experience staying in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, gracious & well-located”
Reviews.Author: piclyo
Reviews.Content: Early in June, my wife and I stayed at the Osmanhan Hotel just down the road from the Aya Sophia and Blue Mosque in old town Istanbul. We were delighted with our pick: the rooms were squeaky clean, spacious and very comfortable overlooking the Mamara sea and within easy walking distance of all the Sultanahmet district. The hotel owners, Mustafa and his brother Hamit, and their staff were warm and most helpful; breakfasts were generous; and the rooftop terrace offered a great retreat from all the street-side hustle and bustle. While in town, we also visited the family's carpet shop, a small, intimate place with great tribal rugs...and we felt well and fairly served here just as we were in the hotel. The Osmanhan is a small hotel that lives up to the boutique label; but it gets full quickly, so book ahead. It's a great value and a great base to explore Istanbul from. Bink Lyon and Martha Picchi

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of Friendly Tranquility in a Bustling City”
Reviews.Author: power2change
Reviews.Content: Great TA reviews fully justified. This is a small intimate hotel with high standards & exceptionally friendly & helpful owners & staff. Excellent location within a short walk of many attractions. Rooms are well furnished & everything worked! As a Brit I have not been a fan of Turkish breakfasts, but the Osmanhan start to the day was very acceptable. Good selection of bread, cereals & juice. Enjoyed an excellent omelette each day & a great setting on the rooftop terrace. Use of this terrace at all other times was a real bonus ( you provide your own drinks/snacks). As there is no lift people who find stairs difficult might struggle a little. I would return without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great place great location”
Reviews.Author: mikesBridport
Reviews.Content: Great location with ultra helpful staff (owner ran us to our restaurant booking as there were taxi problems no charge) Room a little small but immaculateWould use it again

Reviews.Title: “As per expectations”
Reviews.Author: LNRBucks
Reviews.Content: Chose hotel based upon TA recommendations. Very good in all respects but rooms are a little small but OK for short stays. Reception staff excellent - friendly and helpful. Top location being near good restaurants and all the top sites.

Reviews.Title: “A stay here is guaranteed to enhance your trip considerably”
Reviews.Author: TOYOCAT
Reviews.Content: All the great reviews are well deserved. The Osmanhan is a throughly delightful place. Istanbul is a very large city and having a small, friendly staff that feels like family is guaranteed to enhance your trip considerably. The location couldn't be better. All the major sites are within walking distance and the windows are double paned. This combined with the Air conditioner allows for a quiet and peaceful room where you will not be awakened by the call to prayer(which is very early) at the Blue Mosque. The breakfasts, atop the building, with views out across the beautiful water, are delightful. The selection includes cherry and orange juice, eggs, pistachio salami, a variety of cheeses, olives, breads....cucumbers, tomatoes, cereals, rose jam, various fruits, , yogurt...you get the idea. It's a great breakfast in a fantastic location. This is a place with heart. Thank you Mustafa for being an owner on site and having such a caring attitude. Your presence and attention has created a lovely place for those visiting. Fatih and Ahmet , at the front desk, are both wonderfully helpful where ever and whenever they're needed. This is a very special place, with a lot of soul, a stay that I give my highest recommendation. Thelma and Larry Eugene, Oregon

Reviews.Title: “Turkish Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: JohnF_1959
Reviews.Content: The Osmanhan Hotel was a great place to stay in the Sultanahmet section of Istanbul. The location is perfect for seeing the main sights of the city. The Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar, Basilica Cistern, Hippodrome, and Spice Bazaar are all within walking distance. Just around the corner is a row of very good restaurants and pubs on Akbiyik Caddesi. Fahti, the receptionist, was very helpful with suggestions on the best places to eat. The room my son and I had was comfortable with a good shower. The WIFI worked just great. The morning breakfast on the Osmanhan's best attribute, its rooftop eating area, had a great variety of fruit, cereal, olives, bread, meat, and a custom omelette. On a few occasions we took advantage of the rooftop to drink a beer at the end of a long day of sightseeing. And of all of the above is not enough, Mustafa, the owner, is very hospitable and eager to help. The Osmanhan Hotel and the people who run it, made our trip to Istanbul a very memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel in perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: LauraS28
Reviews.Content: Just back from a wonderful three days in Istanbul and can't recommend the Osmanhan Hotel highly enough. Wonderful location, really friendly and helpful staff, a fab roof terrace where we sat, read and had a relaxing early evening beer looking over the water. We'll definitely stay here next time we go to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “At Home in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: nomadgirlBrooklyn
Reviews.Content: We loved this small, intimate hotel with its seven rooms, wonderful roof terrace for breakfasts, and delightful, friendly staff. The price was right. I don't think I've ever met a kinder staff. Great for the individual traveler, budget traveler. We'll stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and very friendly and...”
Reviews.Author: rc2144
Reviews.Content: Amazing location and very friendly and helpful staff. Our favorite part of this hotel was the terrace overlooking the sea of Marmara and the Blue Mosque. Staying at the heart of Sultanahmet is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable o”
Reviews.Author: salkhi
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Osmanhan Hotel can only be described as a wonderful, unforgettable experience. Our room No. 22, overlooks the cobbled streets. It was small but cosy and exceptionally cosy! Outside the hotel during the day yellow taxis park for passengers. But come night time, all is silent and peaceful. We love the bed having stayed in other 4 5 star hotels theirs was the best bed we have slept in. The mattress was firm and supports our backs and the feather quilt is warm and so comforting. Hot water is instant and the water pressure is strong. Choosing accommodation in Istanbul is not easy. There's a wide variety of them, but we decided we wanted the experience of staying in the historical area in Sultanahmet, away from the chain hotels.From the beginning our emails were answered promptly by Fatih and Ahmet. We arrived early before 8.00 a.m. and Ahmet was at the reception to greet us. We were given breakfast. at the terrace. While waiting for our room to be ready we went for a walk around the Sultanhmet area even up to Sultanahmet square. Later we met Fatih and my wife even guessed his age correctly. Ahmet and Fatih were so helpful to us throughout our stay. Fatih helped to carry our luggage on arrival and departure. Ahmet was very kind to lend his English Quranic translation and helped to purchase Turkish perfumes for us. Leyla prepares breakfast and later cleans all the rooms. She is a gem. We visited the owner's carpet shop; Motif Collection. Hamit is passionate about his work and we learned a lot about Turkish carpets and Kilims. We brought a few souvenirs from his shop. Thank you Hamit for also bringing us shopping for Kilim leather bags. There is a hidden treasure in Osmanhan and we found this in the light of Mustafa, the elder brother of Hamit. They say that breakfast is the most important meal of the day and this is so true for us. Mustafa was always there at breakfast and we would wait eagerly for him to bring the Simit. Sometimes his wife would bake cakes which were absolutely delicious and not too sweet. He prepares our favourite Menemen (Turkish scramble eggs). It was so wonderful to see him in the morning. Leyla was also there to help him and later we got to know Haiyyat. We stayed a total of 9 nights and was really sad when we had to leave to another hotel. We had booked a taxi for the transfer but instead Mustafa sent us in his own car braving the traffic jam with our heavy luggage. We will never forget this kind and sincere deed. Thank you so much Mustafa! 2 days we came back to get the perfumes from Ahmet and it really felt like a homecoming, walking the cobbled streets and walking up the steep spiral staircase. The first thing that caught our attention was the familiar smell of breakfast . The breakfast in Osmanhan is delicious! We love the Simit. Oh the smell of the Simit, soft on the inside with a crunch on the outside. Certainly the best Simit comes from Osmanhan 's breakfast table For us the breakfast at Osmanhan was not just a meal, it was momentous event where we spent an hour in the terrace in the morning. If you want to experience Turkish hospitality this is where you want to stay. From the reception desk to the breakfast terrace everything is done with sincerity and warmth. Thank you Osmanhan for the wonderful memories you gave us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, everything you need for a short trip”
Reviews.Author: Hellasgirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideal for the tourist as it's near to the main sites and it's near to the tram. However if you don't want to take public transport everything is still within walking distance. The hotel itself has everything you need. Great hospitality, clean and comfortable rooms and ample breakfast. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely people, just not enough of a building”
Reviews.Author: Monkeyhanger
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review trying not to offend the wonderful owners and staff in this hotel. From the moment I booked this hotel the communications and organisation was first class. When we arrived in Istanbul there was a car to pick us up (25 euro) and then Fatih met us with a lovely smile, he carried our bags up to our lovely room and explained everything. At b/fast (or before) Layla made us coffee or tea whenever we cared for one and it was allways with a smile. The truth is the staff made this hotel...... What I had a problem with was how you entered the building and that was reception, you then went up a spirral staircase and there was 2 rooms on each floor, off the staircase (no landings) on the top floor is the b/fast room and small balcony for 2 tables. There is also a terrace ontop of the b/fast room with one table for 2. This I feel should be made into an area with soft furnishings like the hotel behind, where you can sit in the sun and enjoy a book or a drink. Our room was clean, spacious and the beds very comfortable, the only downside of the room was the taxi rank outside and because of the room positions on each floor, I think they will all have the same noise problems. (see photo) I would recommend this hotel for families with little children because of the stairs, as you can imagine in a spirral staircase, each step is normal size on the outside but very thin on the inside. Please don't let me put anyone off about this hotel, but I would class this as a small B&B

Reviews.Title: “A haven of calm and hospitality in the centre of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: thekhans91
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a real family touch, but at the same time being very professional. The rooms were very clean and tidy. An amazing location in Istanbul. All the staff were warm and welcoming and the hotel was perfect for families with young children. We would definitely come straight there in future visits!

Reviews.Title: “Darling, Clean, and Convenient!”
Reviews.Author: wendyroberts617
Reviews.Content: Very highly recommend this hotel, which has a real feeling of a Bed & Breakfast. Fatih at the front desk is a real sweetheart, speaks beautiful English, and was very helpful to us during our stay. They set up three single beds for my friends and me, and they were each so comfortable with a down mattress topper and duvets. Really comfortable, great shower, and SO conveniently located in the heart of Sultanahmet. I give it 4 stars for sleep quality only because it is a little noisy there - calls to prayer may wake you up, and there are a lot of people walking/ driving around at all hours of the night, but it's part of the charm. Terrific value too!!

Reviews.Title: “charming”
Reviews.Author: Lola_Prague
Reviews.Content: Merhaba people. Would like to leave here a couple of impressions i have from OsmanHan Hotel. Its nice when you arrive to the hotel and you do not need to wait till your room will be cleaned as it happens in many hotels. I got a room immediately. Very friendly stuff at the reception. Received a welcome tea fro free. The room i was accommodated in was on the 3rd floor, fully renovated, shower and wc inside. The best thing ever was the bed. Uh, i wish i could stay there for the whole day just to lay down.Was surprised by the breakfast in the morning, turkish cheese, fresh bread, fruits, olives and turkish tea on the terrace with the Bosporus view. enjoyed the sunny morning happily eating my breakfast on the roof top. I would definitely go back to OsmanHan Hotel again. I am attaching some pics to share with my favourite terrace place. Definitely recommend to stay in!

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: Hydyr
Reviews.Content: i am traveling to Istanbul since long time and i have been in many hotels, but OsmanHan is the one that i can say i felt like home. Located just in perfect place. You can get easily to all historical places in a walking distance. But beside that what i was really impressed is the clean rooms and friendly stuff, who were always ready to help and easy to communicate in English, helping with everything with their smiley faces. For those who really want to have a real Turkish breakfast is a must in OsmanHan Hotel with the terrace view on Bosporus.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: stanley001
Reviews.Content: to be honest,it is the best hotel i have ever lived in. it is so comfortable i stayed there coz of my friend advise and so happy to satyed there the place so confored and so clean

Reviews.Title: “A hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: JulieP55
Reviews.Content: Home from home - comfortable room especially the bed/ TV/fridge/air-con/excellent shower. Great value for money as it includes a lovely breakfast on the roof terrace with such amazing views. The staff are the friendliest, most genuinely helpful people I have encountered on any trip!! The hotel is conveniently situated near some of the most famous sights of Istanbul and near numerous bars and restaurants yet is quiet!! Fahti , on the desk is efficient and helpful - a really successful stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: clanderle
Reviews.Content: We traveled with two teenagers and were so pleasantly surprised by the staff and service! Our rooms were spotless. The beds very comfortable. The breakfast was so nice, and the gals that were serving were unbelievably friendly! We would highly recommend this hotel! I almost for got to mention, free WiFi in the rooms, big bonus with the kids!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly, good value”
Reviews.Author: worldtrade
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels reviewed by tripadvisor and this is definitely one of the best. The staff are very friendly and cheerful, the all-in breakfast is an excellent start to the morning, the hotel is situated within walking distance to the magnificent sites in the old city. There's a good range of restaurants one street up from the hotel. The hotel has free wifi access and guide books that you can borrow.

Reviews.Title: “The number one place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ejk99
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the friendliest, cleanest and most welcoming hotel I have stayed in. I cannot recommend it highly enough. The staff, especially Fatih on the desk, are so friendly and helpul. The rooms are beautifully furnished and well kept. Breakfasts are really enjoyable, with a wide range of food; we were made to feel special having pastries and cakes cooked for us by family. The views from the roof terrace are lovely across the Bosphorus. It is a central location within easy walking distance of the main mosques, shops, restaurants and markets.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, cozy rooms, hospitable staff, great breakfast with a wonderful view”
Reviews.Author: Marie0812
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 6am after a long haul flight from Australia, and were immediately taken to the rooftop breakfast room for coffee and breakfast (although our booking did not officially commence until the afternoon). Watching the sunrise and the traffic on the waterways was an amazing introduction to Istanbul. We enjoyed this start to each day throughout our 11 day stay at the Osmanhan. Although small, with 2 rooms on each floor and a spiral staircase to the rooftop, the hotel has helpful, friendly staff on the front desk 24 hours a day. 2 other obliging staff members prepare and serve an excellent contintental breakfast (juice, tea, coffee, cereals, yoghurt, breads, fruit, salad, cheese and olives) and service the rooms. The owner arrived for breakfast each day with delicious pastries and cake his wife had made. The rooms are very comfortable, attractively furnished, and spotlessly clean. Because the hotel is on a corner, the windows overlook the cobbled streets providing an ever-changing view of daily life. The Hotel is located in Sultanahmet within a short walk of the Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia, Topkapi Palace, the underground Water Cisterns, and various museums. If wanting to go further afield, it is a 5 minute (downhill) stroll to the suburban railway in the morning and a 10 minute (downhill) stroll from the tram in the afternoon. The taxi rank is at the door. Extend the morning downhill walk by 5 minutes and you are at the fascinating seafront parks. 50 meters above the hotel is a street with many wonderful restaurants for the evening meal. A stroll along the nearby streets shopping (or window shopping) is as splendid as visiting a museum.

Reviews.Title: “I loved!”
Reviews.Author: TamashaFukuoka
Reviews.Content: We loved this tiny hotel, which is very clean, friendly and comfortable. It is near to Aya Sophia, Topkapi, Blue Mosque and you can go there by five-minute walk. Although we were planning to stay only one night, we stayed three nights. The rooms are well-lighted and well-equipped. The hotel is cleaned thoroughly and sterilized everyday. (I think it is very important for a family with children.) We had breakfast at the terrace floor with the fabulous seascape of Marmara. We saw even dolphins swimming near the shore! My daughter was very very excited. She also liked the hotel staff (Fatih, Ahmet and Leyla). They are very kind and friendly. So, we spent the stay very comfortably. We strongly recommend this hotel. (The owner can speak Japanese.)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Hospitality and Location”
Reviews.Author: GlobalVillage
Reviews.Content: Short Review The Osmanhan Hotel is a brand new, tiny 8 room hotel providing great service in the historic Sultanamet district. All the major sites are within an easy 5 â€“ 20 minutes walk. We hope to return to Istanbul in the near future and stay at the Osmanhan. Long Review Istanbul is a city filled with historical gems such as Aya Sofya (the Basilica of Hagia Sophia), the Blue Mosque, Galata Tower, the Grand Bazaar, the Spice Bazaar, Topkapi Palace, and the Underground Cistern. One might add the Osmanhan Hotel to the list. Though new and tiny â€“ just 8 rooms -- the Osmanhan Hotel is affordable (even more so considering the sumptuous Turkish breakfast included), provides impeccable service, has beautifully renovated rooms, and is that perfectly located in the Sultanamet district (5-20 minutes from everything). Note: The Osmanhan is a short 2-3 minute walk from the Four Seasons Hotel â€“ so you can rest assured youâ€™re in a â€œgoodâ€� location. The four of us (husband, wife, and two college aged daughters) stayed in two rooms for 6 days. Mustafa, Fatih, Ahmet, and others were most gracious to us whether offering suggestions on where to go, how to say â€œnoâ€� or â€œthank youâ€� in Turkish, filling our water bottles, or talking about their families. On several occasions, Mustafa, the owner, brought homemade pastries from his wife to add to the breakfast feast, which included breads, cheeses, eggs, fruits, meats, salads, and Turkish coffee, tea, and yogurt. Fatih was staffing the front desk the most when we were leaving or the returning to the hotel, so we got to know him the best. He is very knowledgeable and helpful. Istanbul is a friendly city, and is easy to get around, whether by walking, taking the tram, or hopping a public ferry from â€œEuropeâ€� to â€œAsia.â€� All of the museums have signs in Turkish and English. The Osmanhan hotel is in the â€œoldâ€� part of the city near almost all major attractions; you can take a long walk or take a tram to Taksim, the â€œnewâ€� part of the city. Whereas the â€œoldâ€� city is lined with stores selling traditional goods such as rugs, souvenirs, et al, the â€œnewâ€� city is ultra modern, where trendy stores sell the latest fashions. Be sure to visit the rug store run by Hamit Balkir, Mustafaâ€™s brother. We loved the tribal rugs and the stories they told, such as a rug that is sewn in two halves and joined by the wedding of the bride and groom. Istanbul is also a historically tolerant city. During the Inquisition, Turkey welcomed many Jews and Moors who were forced to leave Spain. The Official Turkish Website such as www.kulturturizm.gov.tr list many Churches, Mosques and Synagogues on their must see list. Weâ€™d love to return to Istanbul. When we do, weâ€™ll stay at the comfort, hospitality and location of the Osmanhan. Randall Kay and Marjorie Meyer Burlington, Vermont, USA

Reviews.Title: “A truly superb hotel...”
Reviews.Author: WVogelweide
Reviews.Content: I've travelled several times to Istanbul in the past, and have had varied experiences in hotels there, as can be expected. I can say without exception, that the Osman Han is the best hotel in which I've stayed in Istanbul, or in all of Turkey for that matter! I make numerous short trips each year on business to various cities (mainly in Europe), and would put the Osman Han in the very top handful of hotels I've stayed in (anywhere) in recent years. The hotel is small, personal, beautifully furnished and located in the heart of the Sultanahmet district. Rooms are airy, spotlessly clean, and quiet. The bed was brand new, the ensuite bathroom immaculate, with instant hot water. Also, my room had a wonderful antique carpet on the floor! There's free fast wireless broadband in the hotel, and many amenities very nearby. Particularly enjoyable was the friendly, relaxed atmosphere, between the owners, staff and guests; I had quite a few interesting chats over breakfast and in the reception area with other guests, and with the owner Hamit, who is a very well travelled individual. The reception staff were exceedingly helpful and discrete. Even the cleaning staff, who obviously have limited foreign language skills, went out of their way to be kind and helpful. The breakfast was really exceptional (both in the quality of food, and the choice), and is served on the roof level, where there's a terrace with a magnificent view of the sea and the Asian side of the city. I look forward to my next visit to Istanbul later this year in warmer weather, so I can partake of breakfast outside on the terrace, while gazing across at the Sea of Marmara! I read with bemused astonishment some of the reviews below, one comparing the hotel to "a dungeon" (?), another making the staff sound like small-time hustlers!! I can't begin to fathom how anyone could arrive at such an impression - perhaps they entered some kind of parallel universe while en-route to Istanbul? But I'm reminded of the old Yorkshire saying: "there's nowt so queer as folk..." I'll certainly be returning to the Osman Han!

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest hotel I have encountered in Istanbul - Osman Han”
Reviews.Author: luvIstanbul
Reviews.Content: This is the most friendliest hotel that I came across in Istanbul. The people are very friendly, rooms are clean and very stylish. I would say staying in this hotel worth every penny you, and probably even more that it worth. This place got a very friendly vibe that makes you feel like home and relax yourself after a day in the busy Istanbul. You can have a quiet time in their roof top with your special one, looking out to the Asian zone with a very nice cuppa.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality at its best”
Reviews.Author: RJDPardesiya
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for a one night stay based on its ranking in trip advisor - and they deserve every bit of their high rating. I expected to be happy and was very happy with the place. Just few examples: 1.I ordered a single room but received a large double room. They are very generous. 2.The room was filled with antiques. After talking with Ahmet I understood this is not by co-incidence. He is an expert in antiques restoration so guests benefits from this. 3.And, mentioning restoration...my bag was damaged so owner immediately took his tools and helped me. Isn't this hospitality. 4.My lap top didnâ€™t work, so they borrowed me their lap top for some internet, skyping etc. 5.I had a guest, professor from Istanbul university that joined me for breakfast - and they were so friendly to him as well. 6.From the breakfast terrace almost 360 degrees views, the sea, the blue mosque (I think) and some other old buildings and streets. Could have spend there hours (but had to go for some sightseeing). 7.even in 22 hours stay they had enough time to develop some personal connections with me, some small talks with several of the staff people - all are very nice. Location is perfect. It is in the old city, where in a small area there are many small hotels, restaurants etc. 5 minutes from blue mosque, Aya Sofia etc. Very quite and feels very safe to walk at night. Highly recommended. I will come again in June when I plan t visit Istanbul with by wife and daughter.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with peerless staff”
Reviews.Author: El-Ghiri
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, in a quiet area 2 or 3 minutes' walk from the Blue Mosque, Topkapi, Hagia Sophia, bars, restaurants, shops and tram stop, with a breakfast terrace overlooking the Sea of Marmara and with a close-up, albeit partial, view of the Blue Mosque. Newly renovated building with a definite charm, but admittedly most of the hotels in the area are in similar buildings. Room not luxurious, but perfectly well appointed, comfortable, quiet and spotlessly clean. What made it exceptional, almost unique in my experience, was the staff. All of them, without exception, were at all times faultlessly friendly, attentive, helpful and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Our trip to Istanbul would not have been as wonderful without the Osmanhan”
Reviews.Author: CatherineMinnesota
Reviews.Content: We (my husband and I and our two young adult children) just returned from a two week vacation in Istanbul and Edirne; 9 of those nights were spent at the Osmanhan Hotel. I had originally booked a different hotel that had been recommended by friends, but based on tripadvisor reviews, I decided to change our reservations to Osmanhan. We are all so glad I made that decision! This was the best service we have ever received at a hotel anywhere. The wonderful staff (Ahmet, Leyla, and Birol) made sure we had everything we needed. The owners (Mustafa and Hamit) oversee every detail to make sure all guests are well cared for. And Fatih, the hotel manager, is easily the best hotel manager we have ever met. He speaks excellent English and was unbelievably helpful to us throughout our stay. They were all amazing! Everyone made sure we had the best stay possible. I cannot praise the Osmanhan staff enough. The hotel is small but very comfortable and immaculate. The location is perfect, located in the Sultanahmet, 5-10 minutes from many major sites/monuments. We walked everywhere. The area surrounding the hotel is very clean and convenient - lots of great restaurants (we loved Turquoise!) and a couple small mini markets. Breakfast is provided every morning on a terrace with spectacular views over the rooftops of Istanbul and onto the Sea of Marmara. Breakfast is traditional Turkish, same as other places we stayed, except the quality is better - very fresh bread and fruit, excellent coffee and tea, fresh juices, wonderful yogurts and cheeses, olives, etc. And Mustafa's wife baked fresh cakes or pastries for breakfast almost every morning we were there! Everything is very clean - the terrace, the rooms, the bathrooms, the stairs, the lobby, etc. The showers had good hot water and good pressure. The staff will take care of your laundry for you - send it out and bring it back. There is free wireless throughout the hotel, which we really appreciated. The desk is staffed 24 hours/day. Mustafa and Hamit showed us their carpet shop; they are very knowledgeable about the history and restoration of traditional carpets from Cappadocia. It was fascinating to learn from them! Leyla is there providing wonderful, friendly service every morning at breakfast and also keeps everything immaculate every day! We had to leave at 3:30 AM in order to make our flight, and Ahmet and Fatih even packed us breakfasts for our early departures! We were surprised to learn that the hotel will be closed a few days in January for some remodeling and upgrading - it is already clean, modern, and efficient - so it should be even more spectacular soon! Without hesitation, I highly recommend the Osmanhan Hotel to anyone who is looking for a small, comfortable, clean, extremely well-run hotel in a perfect location in Istanbul. This is only the second review I have ever posted at tripadvisor - the other one (my first) was posted five years ago (Prague). I decided to post this review because Osmanhan is fantastic! Thank you very much for making our stay in Istanbul so memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, clean, good staff and close to the major sites in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Cookie010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Osmanhan Hotel for 5 nights at the end of Nov09 it is in a very good location close to all the major sites and tram/metro stops so getting around Istanbul was easy. The hotel was very clean the room was a good size and the bed was comfortable. The staff were very friendly and more than willing to help with any questions we asked. Breakfast was included and it was the best breakfasts we had while travelling around the Middle East. Would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great place to stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly small place to stay where they make you feel at home.”
Reviews.Author: Ayyaz
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed ay Osman Han for nine nights. We were picked up by the transport at the airport arranged by the hotel. We were welcomed at the reception and our luggage was brought to the room. The room was slightly smaller than we expected, but certainly adequate. It was very clean and it remained very clean throughout our stay with new white linen every day. We could hear some noise outside till around midnight, but that did not bother us very much. Once we got over the jet lag, then there was no problem at all. The top floor, where breakfast was served, had a beautiful view of sea and city. The breakfast had plenty of choice for us and was served by Abdulla and Leyla, who knew little English, but we had no problem getting what we wanted. They were very keen to serve. The rooms had air conditioning, and heating but did not need any of it. The room was smoke free. Fatih and Ahmet who took turns at the front desk were always there to help you with site seeing, shopping and restaurants. We met the owner of the hotel, Hamit, himself a number of times, who made sure we were well looked after. The location of the hotel is fantanstic. Major attractions and the tram at walking distance. If you are a Muslim, which, we are, you can walk to Blue Mosque for prayers. We certainly recommend this hotel without any reservation. Ayyaz, Tahir.

Reviews.Title: “Above average quality, below average price”
Reviews.Author: crispin28
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly nice option in the heart of the Sultanahmet hotel district. The rooms are clean and well-appointed, though not large and ours was a bit musty. The breakfast is excellent, served on a beautiful rooftop deck. The staff was friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Small but friendly”
Reviews.Author: chester1
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights here on the top floor with a view of the sea. The room was nice, clean and spacious. The bathroom was clean but tiny. The staff were very friendly and helpful. There is no elevator. Breakfast was basic but adequate.

Reviews.Title: “a A memorable stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: EastBamboo
Reviews.Content: A nice and tidy hotel, the staff are so firendly and helpful when you need a favor from them. Fatih Ahmed and Abudullah Lara, thank you all! And, for sure, I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “More than perfect..this little place deserves the hype!”
Reviews.Author: bon_vivant_traveller
Reviews.Content: This is the most wonderful little hotel...an absolute gem of a place that we would recommend, and return to, in a second. After a seamless booking via email we arrived after a long flight from Australia at 7.00am with hopes at best of leaving our luggage until we were able to check in later in the day. The ever fantastic Fatih (front desk) immediately looked after us sending us up to the gorgeous rooftop terrace for a huge and wonderful (complementary) breakfast where we drank fantastic coffee and fresh juice, and devoured home made cake, fruit, cheeses and other delicious food and took in the amazing view whilst we recovered until our room was ready. Over the next four days we had a fantastic time based here in a gorgeous room, extremely comfortable, wireless, heaps of hot water and great pressure and all perfectly located and with lovely views. The best aspect of the hotel, apart from the above, is easily the friendly staff and wonderful welcoming service. Recommendations were excellent and no request was too difficult. We tried to extend our stay however the hotel was full so we moved to another hotel after 4 days. The Osmanhan staff after 4 days felt like family (so nice when you are traveling and want to experience another culture!) - the personal care for their guests was extraordinary - they let us come back and use the hotel's wireless internet for free whilst we were guests at another hotel as well as offering for us to take breakfast there again (for free!) after we mentioned the quality of breakfast was poor at our other hotel. These may seem like small things but the genuine care and attention we received from all staff at the Osmanhan will long be a highlight of our trip to Istanbul. This little place deserves the hype!

Reviews.Title: “Small friendly hotel perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: herkulu
Reviews.Content: A most enjoyable short break in Istanbul made more pleasurable by the warm welcome and helpfulness of Fatih and staff. Fabulous breakfasts on the terrace, comfortable very clean rooms and facilities and easy starting point for visits to some amazing places. Our thanks to Fatih, Mustafa and to Hamit for teaching us about carpets !

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maryseattle
Reviews.Content: Thank you to all my fellow tripadvisor friends who recommended this hotel! Clean, nicely decorated, great breakfast, near the best sites in Istanbul and very close to many great restaurants. Oh, left out the best part...Fatih and his staff are wonderful....friendly, helpful and perfect hosts to their beautiful city. We will definately stay at the Osmanhan when we visit Istanbul again. Thank you Osmanhan for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Our strong recommendation”
Reviews.Author: MotomikeChicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights and were very pleased with this new hotel. Great location in Sutanahment (the historic distrcit) - perfect for seeing all the major sights by foot. Lots of restaurants and shops on the surrounding streets. Very, very clean and well run property. Comfortable beds. Excellent service and friendliness from staff. Very good breakfast on a terrace with a view. WiFi in rooms and they let you use a computer, if you don't bring your own. Also, the price is very good when compared to comprable properties.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff; clean rooms; excellent location, highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Lizzipoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights having stayed at their 'sister' hotel the Agora the first night when the Osmanhan was full. From the very start Fatih, the manager was friendly and helpful, offering tips and advice to us. On our last night he upgraded us to another room at no cost. The rooms are small, but tastefully decorated with free Wi-Fi, air-con, flat screen TVs with several English Language channels, the bathrooms are recenly renovated and evrything is very clean. Breakfast on the roof terrace was lovely - wih lots of choice and there was an inside section with bifolding glass doors so that the views could be enjoyed indoors when the weather was not so good. Excellent location only a five minute walk from the Blue Mosque and about seven minutes from the tram stop where you can quickly find your way all over Istanbul. A follow up e-mail from Fatih on our return to England is yet another example of the personal service that you get at this small guest house. We hope to return soon and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ViennaPenguins
Reviews.Content: We had a great 5 days in Istanbul and Osmahan Hotel and Fatih were a big part of that! Great, relaxing place to return to when the hours of walking around Istanbul sights and markets gets too much. Breakfast on the roof-top terrace is really a GREAT way to start the day

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: OzAdventuresome
Reviews.Content: We would highly recommend the Osmanhan as the best place to stay in Istanbul. The service from Fatih on the front desk was excellent. Fatih spoke fluent English and couldn't help enough. We arrived a day early and he did everything possible to find us a room elsewhere in Istanbul as the Osmanhan was full. The room was lovely, and the open air breakfast terrace had amazing views over the Sea of Marmaris. We were allowed to take our own wine and beer onto the terrace in the evenings. Location was excellent - close to all the main attractions and restaurants - about 5 mins walk from the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia. The only issue we found was it was a little noisy outside our window at nights, as our corner seemed to be an informal cab rank.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, accomodation, and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: RoadMode
Reviews.Content: I have only positive things to say about the service at Osmanhan Hotel! Fatih was so good and helpful to us. He is EVER so accommodating! The room was very clean, and everything worked. Its close-in location in Sultanahmet made touring on foot a pleasure. And the Turkish breakfast on the top-floor, open-air terrace with views onto the Sea of Marmara was a treat each morning. But I want to mention the service again: Fatih is the consummate host -- considerate, pleasant, and helpful!! My wife and I enthusiastically recommend the Osmanhan Hotel to anyone visiting the Sultanahmet district of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A Rare Gem”
Reviews.Author: MidnightDreamer
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 5 night towrads the end of October 2009. I had to go to Istanbul on business and a work colleague recommended this great hotel to me. He was really raving about it so I decided to check it out. I really was quite pleased in having done so. I must say that this Hotel is really quite superb. I was really happy with the standard of my room. The room was so spotless. The room had all the amenities that you would need. It had air conditioning , LCD TV with a built in DVD , telephone , wireless internet and a very nice ensuite bathroom. There was also of plently of clean fresh towels everyday. The hotel is located right in the heart of the oldtown where all the top sites are. The Blue Mosque , Aya Sofia and Topkapi Palace are all within a 3 minute walk. There is a very nice breakfast every morning on the roof topwitha fantastic view of the Mamara Sea and the Blue Mosque at the back. What lovely sites to see while eating breakfast. I also made good use of the hotel facilities. It was very nice to unwind in the evening up on the rooftop . There were books to read and DVD's to watch on the big LCD tv while lounging around on the sofas. I found this to be very relaxing The staff were really great too. They were extremely helpful when I asked about sites to see and excursions to do. I would really recommend this as a good place to stay with visiting Istanbul whether it be for business or please. I would really like to thank everyone especially Nadir , Volkan and Cem for really looking after me while I was there

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly and helpful staff, everything worked, good value.”
Reviews.Author: Sweetness66
Reviews.Content: After my stay in the Osmanhan, I was on a tour of Turkey that included 4 and 5 star hotels. Nothing else measured up to the Osmanhan. Everything worked: wifi in my room, the air conditioner, the TV. Buffet breakfast on the roof each morning was fresh and delicious. The young man and woman who prepared it were friendly and attentive. The view of the sea was lovely. Fatih at the front desk spoke English flawlessly and was always helpful. It was an easy walk of a few blocks to the most famous sights of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Formidable”
Reviews.Author: milorr
Reviews.Content: We stayed one week in this hotel. Fatih was VERY helpful and warm. Room was large enough and clean. Shower perfect. On our way back home, we had to stay again in Istambul, as the Osmanhan was full, we had to look for another hotel. We went to many of them around and we did not find another one better. We had to go just in front of it, missing it a lot. For the price, it is the best!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, central, clean and comfortable with free wi-fi”
Reviews.Author: marmpy
Reviews.Content: The hotel's main selling points are its friendly staff and a location close to the major tourist sites of the city. Our room was attractive and clean with a large and comfortable bed and the rooftop terrace was a lovely spot in which to eat breakfast and relax later in the day. The only thing missing for me was some real turkish coffee with my breakfast. Also, be aware that in central Istanbul you can expect to be woken early by the morning call to prayer! If you are looking for a base from which to explore the city and don't mind not having a gym, a bar and room service, then you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable,well located”
Reviews.Author: irina154
Reviews.Content: very much enjoyed staying here...within walking distance of all the major historical sites. close to restaurants and shopping. Hotel staff very efficient and helpful particularly Fatih Oser who was able to make our stay trouble free.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! This is an amazing place!!”
Reviews.Author: walleyeguy
Reviews.Content: Due to a small scheduling error, we arrived in Istanbul at the peak of Ramadan. Very busy place, very busy hotel and they still made time to make our stay perfect. Wonderful personal service, people who really care about you and a very, very nice room. Only draw-back was there are 51 steps to a fourth floor room.......I know.....I counted. The breakfast on the roof is great, with choices of meats, breads, cheeses and toppings for your amazing yogurt. And the vista from the roof-top will take your breath away. The port, the Blue Mosque, the Palace and the Ayasofya and all visable. There are no safes in the rooms, but the front desk is always manned and they have a safe there for all your valuables. The rooms have great air conditioning, lots of space and a bathroom that is top notch. Plenty of light come in through multiple windows - and it's quiet. You are truly centrally located within easy walking distance to all the above features. I honestly can't think of any way they could improve this experience (save putting in an elevator, but that's not physicaly possible) My honest rating is 10 out of 10

Reviews.Title: “Loved this spot”
Reviews.Author: LeilaA
Reviews.Content: The room was beautiful, bright, airy, sleek, and clean. The location was perfect and very convenient. The staff was incredibly helpful and nice. The rooftop terrace was lovely. The room was quiet (double-paned glass on the windows) and perfect for a quiet night's sleep. I loved this spot! Thanks Osmanhan Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: TotalTravel99
Reviews.Content: The stay in Osmanhan hotel was excellent. The prices in Istanbul's restaurants and cafes were very reasonable and let you only wonder why food in the USA is such a crap and expensive!? I hope there must be a good reason for that.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Kochevnik
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Osmanhan Hotel for 3 nights, based on the reviews we saw here. Our stay was absolutely wonderful. Fatih was very informative, kind and friendly. He'll provide a laptop if you need one to access the hotel's wireless internet, and can even help you plan excursions out of the city. The service was great, and we even received a thank-you email after our stay. Our room was on the ground floor near the front desk, but we were given a very good deal on it (65EUR for a double, a 10EUR discount!), and it was clean, quiet and very well modeled (the bathroom was quite well-designed). The breakfasts on the rooftop were FANTASTIC! The food was a fresh assortment of meat, eggs, vegetables, fruits, olive, bread and jam (standard Turkish breakfast, but excellent quality), with great and friendly service, plenty of coffee and tea and even water to fill your bottles up for the day's excursions. The views from the rooftoop at the Sea of Marmara were amazing, and the hotel is very conveniently located near Haghia Sofia, Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace. It is just located about a block away from the "tourist" part of Akbiyik Caddesi, which is the best of both worlds, as your stay is quiet (and you don't have to listen to all the ruckus up the street if you don't want; I would recommend trying other streets in Sultanahmet for more authentic restaurants). We arrived at the hotel from Ataturk Int'l Airport: our transport was arranged by Fatih and included in the hotel bill (25EUR). You can definitely find cheaper transportation alternatives from the airport, but you do save yourself the hassle of carrying luggage on the metro (the closest stop is a fair distance from the hotel if you're carrying anything). Also, bear in mind that you will receive a discount on your stay and all charges (the minibar is very reasonably priced, by the way) if you pay in cash. Overall, I would say that staying at the Osmanhan was a terrific experience: when we return to Istanbul, we will definitely stay at the Osmanhan!!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant staff, brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Karen60Mansfield
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Osmanhan Hotel for 3 nights at the beginning of September 2009. I had read the excellent reviews on Tripadvisor and they had prompted me to book the hotel. The price was reasonable, the location absolutely brilliant (best and prettiest part of the city) and the hotel was immaculately clean. However, what made the hotel OUTSTANDING was the quality of the service. All members of staff were polite, efficient and friendly, but Fatih really was the icing on the cake. He helpfully answered several emails before we travelled and almost felt like a friend by the time we arrived. We have travelled extensively and have received good service on many occasions, but our experience with Fatih went well beyond. He was an absolute delight. Breakfasts were delicious and completely fresh, taken on the delightful roof terrace overlooking the Bosphorus. There are lots of very good restaurants on the street round the corner from the hotel. We found them to be of a very high quality, reasonably priced and service was very good. There are also lots of small mini-markets for water and the hotel is happy for you to buy alcohol to take back to the hotel (there is no bar) which can be drunk in your room or up on the roof terrace. We flew into Sahiba Gocken airport and used the Havas bus as far as Taksim Square, then got a taxi to the Aya Sophia which is just a 5 minute walk from the hotel. The journey took us about 2 hours due to the traffic. However, I would recommend using one of the local travel agents and booking a return minibus shuttle with them. It worked out slightly cheaper but was so much more convenient, picking us up from the hotel and, despite a few pickups on the way, delivered us back to the airport in half the time. All in all, a fabulous stay in a brilliant hotel and I just wished we'd had room in our suitcases to bring Fatih home with us!

Reviews.Title: “Good bed & breakfast located in a historic part of town”
Reviews.Author: arununni
Reviews.Content: The Osmanhann is located within walking distance of the Sultanahment (Blue Mosque) and Hagia Sophia. The neighbourhood is dotted with Bed & Breakfasts. The rooms are nice and cozy. Breakfast is served at the rooftop, overlooking the ocean. So, full marks for location Fateh a the front desk is a cheerful guy, willing to help tourists plan their day & way around Istanbul. The hotel is not grand or fancy like a 3-4 star, so do bear in mind that you should expect a Bed & breakfast....a good one at that! A couple of things to bear in mind...this place has no elevator, and we were staying on the 4th floor, so you know what that feels like after a full day of walking in Istanbul. Second, if you are planning to get from the airport to Sultanahment by train+tram, you will have to drag your suitcases up/down cobbled streeets/sidewalks and it can tire you a fair bit.

Reviews.Title: “Fatih makes this the best hotel you'll ever stay”
Reviews.Author: anastosb
Reviews.Content: The rooms are large and clean and decorated very well. The bathroom is modern and a very good size by European standards. The location is superb, close to all the major sites and tram. The rooftop terrace had the most beautiful view of the Marmara and Blue Mosque. I could not have asked for a more charming place to stay. All of the staff were very polite and ready to assist. However, it was Fatih, the daytime concierge who helped make this an unforgettable trip. He is excellent at running the hotel but is also a very kind person. He did not treat you as a guest, but as a friend. Thank you Fatih! If I could live at the Osmanhan, I would!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: praisejah
Reviews.Content: Impeccable Condition, Comfortable, Upscale, and Extremely Friendly Staff! Book early if you want a room. Thanks Fatih and Hamit for a great stay in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “The absolute best hotel in Istanbul....don't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: dbc101
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough great things about my stay at the Osmanhan hotel. The service Hamit and Fathi gave us was out of this world! I dont think our stay would have been the same if it wasn't for them. We were initially planning to only stay for 3 nights but after the 3rd night there we couldn't fathom going to a different hotel. My luggage was lost for 3 days by Turkish Airlines and I was completely distraught. Both Fathi and Hamit were on top of the airline trying to track my luggage and went as far as complaining to the higher ups of Turkish Air. If it wasn't for the 20 calls they were making per day my luggage would have been lost for good. As for the hotel itself, the showers are the best! And Im a stickler about good water pressure. The hotel is small as well with only about 7 rooms so you the personal attention given by the staff is superior. Also, the breakfast they have every morning on the terrace is wonderful! Fathi and Hamit we'll be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant position, wonderful service, highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Victoria996
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Osmanhan Hotel for three days and I have to say how impressed we were with the welcome we received and helpfulness during our stay. Fatih who works on reception is really nice with his constant smile and nothing is too much trouble. The breakfast is taken on the roof terrace overlooking the Bosphorous, which is wonderful, with cereal, fresh fruit including melon, peaches and figs, eggs, cheese and fresh warm bread, The bedrooms are clean with constant hot water which we discovered is not the same in other places! The position is in the old/historic part of town so is wonderful for seeing all the sights. I cannot speak highly enough of this hotel and we were impressed ourselves with all the positive reviews about it and will be recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: brasileirinha
Reviews.Content: After reading only great reviews for this hotel here, we decided to take the risk. Well, since the time of our reservation, we had the most attentive and friendly service. The hotel is well located, comfortable and the staff were really amazing, and honestly, for us who love travelling, this really makes a difference. Fatih, who is in charge of the reception, welcomed us wit a big smile and was really helpful and friendly during our stay. We stayed there for 5 nights and really enjoyed. We definitely recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay, the most amazing service”
Reviews.Author: law-and-mark
Reviews.Content: I couldn't say enough about the service at this hotel, it's probably the best service we've ever received. All the staff are so helpful and nothing is too much to give help and advice either before or during the trip, they really made our stay. In addition to this the rooms are a great size, modern, very very clean and the location is great. We would definitely stay here again and would not hesitate to highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The Osmanhan was absolutely charming and in the perfect spot for all our adventures.”
Reviews.Author: AnnaTahoe_California
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed in this new and beautiful hotel. The rooms were beautifully decorated with gorgeous views. Breakfast with Turkish coffee on the deck every morning was an amazing way to start our adventures. The Osmanhan is centrally located and surrounded by wonderful restaurants and shops. The staff was courteous and extremely helpful. I will definitely be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Turkish hospitality is alive and thriving at the Osmanhan Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: masonhere
Reviews.Content: Turkish hospitality is alive and thriving at the Osmanhan Hotel. My wife and I wholeheartedly, unreservedly recommend the Osmanhan Hotel. The hospitality we enjoyed there was as much a part of our experience of Istanbul as anything else. We had the best hotel experience of our lives. Fatih, Ibrahim, Leyla and Ahmet made sure our stay was as comfortable and pleasant as possible. And Hamit and Mustafa, the owners, were often around to bring us Turkish coffee and anything else we needed. The hotel is ideally located in Sultanahmet which is where you want to be. The Blue Mosque and Aya Sofya are just a short walk away and Topkapi is literally just around the corner. Just past Aya Sofya is the tram line that can take you to Taksim Square and Iskital Street (an area you definitely need to visit to see the real Istanbul) and almost every other place you'd like to go in Istanbul. Just a half block up the street beside the Osmanhan is a street lined with restaurants and bars so you won't have to walk very far for lunch and dinner. The Turquoise is especially good. One of their dishes is to cook meat (lamb, beef, or chicken) in a clay pot with vegetables. The pot is then broken open at the table with a metal rod. Delicious! A block away from the Osmanhan in the other direction is Balikci Sabahattin, said to be the best fish restaurant in Istanbul. It is not cheap but there can't be fresher fish on the planet. Delicious! Walking in that same direction for ten minutes you arrive at the Bosphorus where you can sit on benches and enjoy the panorama of Istanbul and gawk at the huge tankers that pass by. A vendor will probably pass by selling simit, Turkish sesame bagels. Our room was spotless, comfortable and welcoming. The bed was one of the most comfortable we've ever slept in. The bathroom was new, very modern, and again spotless with a great shower and a heated towel rack for winter months. The wireless Internet worked perfectly. And we had a control to set the air conditioning to the temperature we desired. Each day Leyla made sure we had everything we needed. When we needed an iron one quickly appeared. They also sent out our laundry to be washed. From the several hours of research I did on Istanbul I can safely say the Osmanhan is a great bargain, too. To alter an old saying, you get more than you paid for, much more. The breakfast buffet was packed with fresh fruit, cherry and orange juice, cereal and different pastries. One morning Mustafa's wife baked a cake with sweet and sour cherries and chocolate drizzled over the top. A real treat! And, of course, there was always great yogurt. The rooftop terrace where breakfast is served was described by my wife as a little bit of heaven. And it is. You have a panoramic view of the Bosphorus and a bird's eye view, literally, of the Blue Mosque. In the afternoon if you wanted a relaxing break you could sit on the terrace and enjoy the views and the street life below. Almost every evening we ended our day on the terrace enjoying the cool air, usually a breeze, and the tranquility. Perfect! We cannot praise the Osmanhan staff too much. Fatih was always there making sure we were comfortable and knew where we were going. He often got cabs for us and explained where we wanted to go. His intervention meant we got a fair price for our cab ride. He also gave us hints, made suggestions, and made reservations for shows and restaurants. He could not have been kinder, more professional, or more knowledgeable. Ibrahim made our breakfasts an ideal start to the day. I don't know how many cups of tea and coffee he brought us. It might be in the hundreds. And always with a smile. We miss the Osmanhan and Istanbul and are already planning on returning. Both are experiences not to be missed. Thanks. David and Betsy

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: LonganFamily
Reviews.Content: I and my husband stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in early June. It was a wonderful experience. We stayed in different hotels from Euro 45 to 120 in our two-week trip in Turkey. This is the one that provided us all-round satisfaction. Volcan and Hamit are attentive to every details to ensure that everything is right. They really treat the guests as friends. We changed our plan and arrived from Amarsa two days earlier than our booking in a weekend. As it was full house, they were care enough to make their greatest effort to find us a few options at different budget for our choice. While they were busy in making the enquiries for us, we were treated to have a free breakfast and then we were even driven to the hotel of our choice. This hotel has a Turkish outlook and recruits very good staff. All of them are sincere, friendly and helpful. Its inside is new and modern. It's cleaningness, VCD TV (signal of international channels not clear though), well-functioning air-conditioner, stable and strong water pressure, laptop computer for lending can compare with any 5-stars hotel. Every morning we ate our breakfast in the terrace with a view of the Marama Sea. The choice was not as many as the large hotels but I particularly liked the seasonal fruits (cherries, strawberries, water melons etc...) and homemade cake. Then, with the warm greetings and great smile of Fatih, we were off our road to Istanbul adventures. After a whole day sight-seeing, with its good location, we could return to our lovely room within a short time. We could then have a shower and quickly check emails in our air-conditioned room. Once, we were cool down, we brought our drinks and went upstairs again to the terrace to enjoy the sunset scene or if after dark watch the seagulls flying around the spotlighted minarets of Blue Mosque. As there are only 8 rooms, make your booking early and I am sure you'll enjoy your stay and find it very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, and helpfull”
Reviews.Author: TravelholicEngland
Reviews.Content: Small, very clean hoptel with excellent breakfast served on roof top. Fatih on reception was extremely helpfull without being overbearing. In great location 3 minute walk from Blue Mosque with plenty of resturants nearby. Could not ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully welcoming”
Reviews.Author: super-intrepid
Reviews.Content: I just left the Osmanhan hotel where I enjoyed two nights with friends. They had come to Istanbul to tour the old city and we found this sweet boutique hotel where the service was excellent, the rooms modern and complete with most amenities--including free wireless and A.C.--and the location for touring was superb. This part of the city is understandably a little noisy, as it is the center of tourism for Istanbul, but where the hotel is located, the noise is not excessive. Breakfast was good, and included a homemade cherry cake baked by the wife of one of the staff. All staff were very helpful, and one even arranged to purchase my train ticket to Ankara. I'd stay here again if I needed to be in the Sultan Ahmet area.

Reviews.Title: “Really great hotel! Really great location! Really great staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: mederrr
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Osman Han for 10 days. Location is amazing (10 mins walk to the Blue Mosque). The staff was super friendly to us and helpful anytime we had a question about the city and things to do. They all spoke English and the room was big, clean and with a view, very cosy. They served a modest breakfast of yogurt, dried fruits, cheese, eggs, tomatoes and bread every day on a terrace with an amazing view.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Rodrigo_9
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Europe for 3 weeks. We booked many of our hotels (including this one) based on reviews we read from TripAdvisor. We were a bit skeptical since we had a few bad experiences with hotels on the trip before arriving to Istanbul. Fortunately, we had no surprises with OsmanHan. The hotel is exceptionally clean and feels very new (i think it is less than a year old). However, what made this a truly unique experience was the staff. Fatih was by far one of the nicest hotel managers we have come across in a while. He will do anything and always with a smile on his face. We would definitely recommend the hotel for other young couples.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good value, fantastic location, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: tripadsa
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Osmanhan for 7 nights. It is a brand new hotel, in a very nice location; very, very close to Hagia Sophia and Blue mosque. We became frineds with Fatih, Mohammad, Ibrahim, the lovely lady at the breakfast and Hamed Balkir, the owner, his wife and beautiful daughter (The same age as our son). All extremely friendly and helpful they spared no effort to help us plan our days and our shopping and ...God bless them. They are trying their best to run this cosy, lovely hotel. It is a small hotel, with a very small reception and narrow stairs, which was no problems for us. The breakfast is all you can ask for a healthy breakfast adn fresh and no frills. The bathrooms which are utterly important for me were really new and clean. the bes mattresses were so comfy,we had the best of sleep, with double-gazed small windows. I hope they keep up the good work and keep maintain the high standard. They even did not charge us for the lamp shade my sun broke!! I have some very minor suggestions however for the owner (just to help them keep Osmanhan as good as it is, because we will come back!!), which surely increases the already high standards of theis lovely hotel: The hardware generally might need some replacement with more sturdy types to minimize the need to repair them frequently, and to outlive the wear and tear associated with hotel rooms, such as the toilet seat covers, window handles and locking systems, thicker light bulbs!!, gas and water heating system, some fine tuning of TV channels, some extra safety rails and non-slip edges for the stairs, covering the staircase walls with wooden pannels to minimize the bruising to the walls and the need to repaint them, To add the turkish flair, some simit for the breakfast, some tea in traditional turkish narrow-waisted glass cups fro breakfast and may be some fresh orange juice at an aditional cost. Thanks to all of you

Reviews.Title: “It is real sensation of real Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: RuslanaR
Reviews.Content: We tried to keep this hotel as our secret, we tried to save this marvelouse piece of real Turkish and Byzantium world only for us. And now we have decided to share it with you becouse we are sure if you want to know about real Istanbul you must stay in Osmanhan Hotel. Two general subjects make this hotel as unique place. First of all there are people. Volcan and Hamit created and drive Osmanhan Hotel. Of course, they are special people and you feel it from first words and first view in Osmanhan Hotel, they hire well trained and as extremely polite as it posiible only in Byzsantium and Istanbul personnel. (And believe us you never foget Vlocan's cakes) The second subject is location, of courcse. We know Istanbul very well - we walked over all new and old streets - and when we up to the terrace of Osmanhan Hotel for breakfast or for our romantic evening with bottle of excelent Capadocia wine we see the Maramara, Golden Horn and Prince Ilands. If you open any book of Orhan Pamuk and up your eyes from pages to this view you feel like time is changed and you are in Istanbul world of greatest Turkish writer. Saddenly you hear a call of greengrocer from the street, you look down to small street wich cuts the area as many streets of old town and sensation of real Istanbul fill up you soul. You look up againg forward to the Maramara and Prince Ilands and you feel by each cell of your soul like something great old and beatiful shine beside you in sunset rays - it is Aya-Sofia. You are so close to this eternaty place that you can touch it. This is Osmanhan Hotel and only this hotel can give these feelings. Ruslana & Maxim Ruslana.R@hotmail.com For Russian readers: http://soulfuldoctor.spaces.live.com/blog/cns!5261E3D941C23AC2!251.trak

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and cosy small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frank M
Reviews.Content: This new hotel has just 8 rooms. It is very comfortable and cosy. Sometimes the staff struggle a bit to get things right, but were always helpful. Good enough breakfast with nice view of Sea of Marmara. Beware of the steep climb to the Sultanahmet area attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - Thank you Fatih”
Reviews.Author: mashrafi
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Osmanhan for 5 nights in late May after reading the good reviews on Trip Advisor and wanting a centrally located base in Sultanamet from which to explore the sights of Istanbul. Was not disappointed. Great location, friendly and attentive staff (especially Fatih) and a comfortable stay. Very cosy and you are very well looked after and again mentioning the very helpfull staff and always make you feel welcome. There were 8 of us in total and all of us thouroghly enjoyed our trip and the hotel - recommend to all, best place to stay in istanbul Mukhtar, Sabina & the rest of the crazy bunch!!

Reviews.Title: “I recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pretty_Picky_Tourist
Reviews.Content: First of all, I definitely recommend this hotel. I normally don't trust reviews too much, but this time all the good things (and a few small flaws) mentioned by other reviewers about the hotel are true. Pros: Very cozy and clean (everything is new), nice rooftop terrace with great view, very friendly and helpful staff (among the best I have seen), 5-10 minutes walk from major tourist attractions in Sultanhamet, lots of restaurants around, very safe, high-speed Internet -- all in all, the hotel offers very good value for the money. Cons: Rooms are just a little small, but there is still sufficient room (and there is an option of ordering a bigger room for extra 10 Euros). A little noisy during the day due to construction near the hotel (it's a temporary problem though). If you are looking for luxury, it's going to cost more than 75 Euros per night, but if you need a clean, cozy and conveniently located place with all the key amenities, but still affordable, it's your hotel.
